科號  Course Number ： 11220AES
450600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：應⽤⽣態學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applied Ecology
任課教師  Instructor ：曾晴賢  Chyng-shyan Tzeng
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 618 ／ 28
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
應⽤⽣態學的整體授課核⼼為：讓同學從了解⾃然運作的邏輯、認知到尊重⾃然的重要性，和能夠善
⽤⾃然的⼒
量來解決問題和創造可能的機會。因此本課程⾸先要講述⽣態學的基礎理論內容，讓修課的同學再深
入的了解基
本⽣態學概念，培養學⽣具備基本的⽣態學知識。其次，從本地已⾄全球的案例，講述⽣態與環境失
衡的問題如
何發⽣，和因應與解決之道。最後再講述更多運⽤⽣態智慧，創造利基的案例，讓同學可以確實的了
解從基礎理
論到應⽤的轉譯過程，可以⽣態學的表徵開始，體會到實務的應⽤。
指定⽤書： Ecology: Concepts and Applications (Botany, Zoology, Ecology and
Evolution) 9th Edition/Manuel Molles, Anna A. Sher, McGraw-Hill Education (2022)
參考書籍： Journal: Basic and Applied Ecology
教學⽅式：  講解和討論
教學進度：
Part 1 基礎⽣態學概念（ 1~6 週）
1: 課程與教師相關經驗簡介
2: 基礎⽣態學概念：⽣態學研究的不同層級、⽣物間、⽣物與環境間的相互關係與作⽤
Part 2 ⽣態學的研究⽅法與分析（ 7~12 週）
3: 野外調查的⽅法與分析
4. ⽣態系統模擬與應⽤
5. 分⼦⽣態學研究
6. 復原與保育⽣態學：案例與應⽤
Part 3 ⽣態的智慧與運⽤（ 13~16 週）
7: 傳統⽣態智慧在⽣活、⽣產與⽣態（三⽣）上的應⽤。
8. 現代⽣態智慧的應⽤：數理化基礎的⽣態智慧在三⽣上的應⽤與展望。
（上課進度視學⽣學習的狀況會做適度的調整）
本課程皆採 16 週⽅式進⾏，作法以縮短期末報告⽅案展⽰時間，輔以期中專題指導作為分數評量，並
於16週內導
入額外學習資源。
成績考核：
第⼀次段考（第 6 週）  : 30%
第⼆次段考（第 12 週）  : 30%
期末考 : 30%
平常考核（出席與問答）  : 10%
AI 使⽤規則：  完全開放

科號  Course Number ： 11220AES
520200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：綠⾊科技
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Green technology
任課教師  Instructor ：周⼦勤
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
I. Course descriptions
Green technology is a novel multidisciplinary science, including chemistry,
physics, biology as well as material sciences, to not only monitor, model and
conserve the natural environment and resources, but also curb the negative
impacts
of human activities. In this course, basic concepts and applications of green
technology are discussed; furthermore, circular economy for sustainable
environment is also introduced to provide students a picture that how green
technology utilize to our daily life in the future.
II. Students learning outcomes
After studying green technology, students should have the abilities described as
following,
1. To realize the fundamentals and theories of green technology, including
renewable energy, environmental purification/remediation, green
catalysis/materials and circular economy.
2. To have the abilities to distinguish and describe the pros and cons of
different renewable energy.
3. To be familiar with different environmental remediation as well as
purification
techniques.
4. To be able to illustrate the content and significance of circular economy.
III. Required texts/materials
Handout and journal articles
IV. Grading
Midterm exam= 30 %, Final exam= 30 ％ , Final report= 40%
V. Course outline
1. The developments of green technology
2. The principles and applications of green technology
3. Renewable energy
4. Green catalysis
5. Green materials
6. Air/water purification
7. Environmental remediation
8. Circular economy
VI. Guidelines of AI-assisted writing and presentation
Conditionally open; please specify how generative AI will be used in course
output.

530100學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
15
中文名稱  Course Title ：空氣品質量測
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Air quality characterization
任課教師  Instructor ：林采吟
上課時間  Time ： WaWbWc 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程主要介紹與空氣品質，淨零排放相關之國內外環境法規與空氣污染物量測技術。課程進⾏⽅式
包含
簡報式主題講述及互動型態專題討論與研究。可⾏時，將安排實務型態量測設備與實驗室參訪。互動
型態
專題討論內容由修課同學選定主題，經與授課老師討論後即可開始進⾏。可⾃⾏決定以⼩組型態（ 2
⼈）或
個⼈⽅式展開專題研究，研究成果可由各專題⼩組⾃⾏提議報告展現的型式。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Textbooks)
無（簡報型式講義，講義內容依據近年環境政策更新）
三、參考書籍 (References)
課程中提供建議書單
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1.簡報⼝述講授
2.最新空氣品質相關環境議題討論
3.學⽣⾃提之學期研習專題討論
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1.概述空氣品質與氣候變遷
2.氣狀污染物及其量測技術
3.粒狀污染物及其量測技術
4.空氣品質監測專題討論
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1.申論作業報告（三次） :45%
⼝頭申論作業簡報，每次報告時間⼗分鐘，同學提問⼗分鐘，每次簡報佔學期成績 15 % ；此外，
需針對同學上台報告內容進⾏提問，三次申論作業的報告期間位修課同學需累計⾄少 3 次提問，未達
提問次
數，每少 1 次扣減學期總分 ( 百分制 )2 分。
2.專題討論研究報告 :40%
於期初擇定學期研習專題的題⽬與合作夥伴後，提交專題構想書，構想書內容佔學期成績 10 % ；期末
進
⾏專題⼩組報告，報告佔學期成績 30% 。學期間，修課同學可針對研擬之專題跟授課教師做互動討
論。
期末研習專題報告期間，每位修課同學需累計⾄少 3 次提問，每少 1 次扣減學期總分 ( 百分制 )2 分。
3.課堂參與及隨堂練習回復： 15%
評量標準包含 (1) 申論作業與期末專題報告期間提問次數與內容， (2) 隨堂練習提交次數與內容等。
附註：
a.期末不接受補交學期間的申論報告，請修課同學務必按時提交。
b.專題討論研究報告以 2 ⼈⼀組為原則，專題構想書內容應包含研究主題的分⼯⽅式。
七、 AI使⽤規則
1.有條件開放，
2.學⽣可於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議
題發
想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。然⽽，在本課程的「個⼈反思報告」、「⼩組採訪作業」中，
學⽣
不得使⽤⽣成式 AI ⼯具撰寫作業。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或相關單位有
權重
新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。
3.本⾨課授課教材或學習資料不引⽤ / 使⽤⽣成式 AI 。

540400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：分⼦光譜學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Molecular Spectroscopy
任課教師  Instructor ：周⼦勤
上課時間  Time ： R2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
A. Course Description
A general introduction to atomic as well as molecular spectroscopy.
B. Textbooks and materials
Rita Kakkar, Atomic and Molecular Spectroscopy: Basic Concepts and Applications,
1st Edition, Cambridge University Press (2015).
Douglas A. Skoog, F. James Holler and Stanley R. Crouch, Principles of
Instrumental Analysis, 7th Edition, Cengage Learning (2017).
C. Teaching Method
Oral presentation with slides and handouts
D. Syllabus
1. Introduction to Spectroscopy
2. Molecular Symmetry and Character Table
3. Light matter Interaction
4. Experimental Methods for Spectroscopy
5. Vibrational Spectroscopy
6. Electronic Spectroscopy
7. Photoelectron Spectroscopy
8. Applications of Spectroscopy in Catalysis
E. Evaluation
Midterm exam 35%, Final presentation 35%, Final exam 30%
F. This course does not involve the use of AI.
科號  Course Number ： 11220AES
580500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：空氣汙染控制
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Air Pollution Control
任課教師  Instructor ：林坤儀
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 618 ／ 28
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明 (Course Description): Introduces the methods and equipment for controlling
granular and gaseous air pollutants, allowing students to understand the control
equipment commonly used in the industry and its design and operating principles,
and explain the collection efficiency and application of various control
equipment.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books): Air Pollution Control: A Design Approach
● 參考書籍 (References): N/A
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method): Lecture-based learning
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Air Pollution
2. Introduction to Particulate Matters (PMs)
3. Physical and chemical properties of Particulate Matters
4. Control Process for PM: Settling tank and Cyclone
5. Control Process for PM: Electrostatic Precipitator
6. Control Process for PM: Fabric house
7. Control Process for PM: Scrubber
8. Control Process for gaseous pollutants: volatile organic compounds
9. Control Process for gaseous pollutants: SOx
10. Control Process for gaseous pollutants: NOx
11. Control process for Greenhouse gases
12. Overview of control processes for power plants
● 成績考核 (Evaluation): exams and homeworks
Assignment ( 作業 ) & Attendency ( 出席 ): 20% ，
Midterm ( 期中考 ): 40%; Final ( 期末考 ): 40%
● 敘明學⽣使⽤  AI 的規則 (Indicate which of the following options you use to manage
student use of the AI)
(1)完全開放使⽤且無須註明
Unrestricted use with no disclosure required
(2)有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出
Conditionally open; please specify how generative AI will be used in course output
(3)禁⽌使⽤，請註明相關的監管機制
Prohibited use; please specify relevant oversight
(4)本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤
Not applicable

中文名稱  Course Title ：星系天文學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Galactic Astronomy
任課教師  Instructor ：江國興
上課時間  Time ： W6W7W8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 521 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is intended for graduate and senior undergraduate students whose major is Physics or
Astrophysics. We will discuss various aspects of galaxies, such topics as morphology,
classification, kinematics, detailed components, cosmic distance ladder, formation, evolution of
galaxies, and the universe at high redshift. This course will be offered in English
⼆、課程內容  (Course Content)
1. Astronomical measurements
2. Stellar evolution and star clusters
3. The Milky Way Galaxy
4. Galactic interstellar medium
5. Surface photometry & luminosity profiles of galaxies
6. Kinematics and mass distribution of galaxies
7. Elliptical galaxies
8. Spiral structure of galaxies
9. Barred galaxies
10. Interaction between galaxies
11. Quasars and active galactic nuclei (AGN)
12. Galaxy formation and AGN feedback
13. The cosmic distance ladder
14. The high-z Universe
15. Observational cosmology
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. An Introduction to Modern Astrophysics (2nd ed.) by B. W. Carroll & D. A. Ostlie (2006,
Pearson Addison-Wesley)
2. Galactic Astronomy (2nd ed.) by J. Binney & M. Merrifield (2008, Princeton University
Press)
3. Galaxies and Cosmology (2nd ed.) by F. Combes, P. Boisse, A. Mazure, & A. Blanchard (2002,
Springer)
4. Active Galactic Nuclei by J.H. Krolik (1999, Princeton University Press)
5. Unresolved Problems in Astrophysics by J.N. Bahcall & J.P. Ostriker (1997, Princeton University
Press)
6. Fundamentals of Galaxy Dynamics, Formation and Evolution by Ignacio Ferreras (2019, UCL Press)

⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This is a graduate level course on star and planet formation. Lectures will cover
a broad range of topics in star formation from clouds, dense cores, protoplanetary
disks, planet formation, Kuiper Belt, meteorites, and exoplanets. It will cover
both theory and observational aspects of star formation. Students should have
prerequisite skills in physics (E&M, quantum), computer programming (python or C),
writing (English), presentation (English), and mathematics.

High-mass star formation
Disk evolution and formation
Grain growth and dust composition
Planet formation
Chemical evolution of protostellar matter
Kuiper belt objects and debris disks
Meteorites
Primitive solar system composition
Exoplanets

科號  Course Number ：
11220ASTR600800學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：天文物理的前沿⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Frontier of Astrophysics Seminars II
任課教師  Instructor ：後藤友嗣
上課時間  Time ： TnWnRn 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
-課程說明  (Course Description)
It is an important task for all researchers to keep up with the latest publications in their
field. However, in the field of astronomy alone, nearly 40 new papers are published every
day. It is a significant amount of work to keep up with this flood of papers. The purpose
of this course is to train students to efficiently read and understand the essence of new
research papers within a limited amount of time. Students will spend no more than one
hour reading a paper of their choice and will then take turns presenting a short
summary in 10 minutes. The focus will be on understanding the main points rather than
getting into the details. It is not necessary to read every single detail of the paper.
Additionally, other students in the class will have a valuable opportunity to learn about
the latest papers while listening to the speaker. After each presentation, the instructor
will teach a relevant physics concept related to the reviewed paper.
The course will take place every Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday from 12:10 pm to 1
pm. During each session, two papers will be reviewed. Therefore, over the course of one
semester, we will review almost 100 papers. By the end of the semester, students will be
familiar with the latest advancements in astronomy.
Previous knowledge is not required. We will focus on learning key concepts of
astronomy as they arise in research papers. This approach reflects the practical and
realistic nature of everyday research life. The course will be conducted in English.
Use of AI : Unrestricted use with no disclosure required
-參考書籍  (References)
Papers to be presented are selected from the following archive servers.
https://www.benty-fields.com/
https://arxiver.moonhats.com/
http://arxiv.org/list/astro-ph/new
-教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Presentations by students followed by a review by the instructor.
-成績考核 (Evaluation)
Attendance, questions, and presentations.

中文名稱  Course Title ：天文輻射物理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Astrophysical Radiative Processes
任課教師  Instructor ：陳惠茹
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 521 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is intended for graduate and senior undergraduate students whose major
is Physics or Astrophysics. We will discuss fundamentals of radiative transfer,
radiation fields, and various emission mechanisms to generate radiation in
astrophysical systems. The class is aimed at building a solid foundation for
students to further pursue astrophysical research in all fields of astronomy.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
Handouts based on Radiative Processes in Astrophysics by G. B. Rybicki & A. P.
Lightman 1979, Wiley-VCH (electronic version available on campus network)
三、參考書籍  (References)
An Introduction to Modern Astrophysics (2ed) by Carroll & Ostile 2007, Pearson
Stellar Atmospheres (2ed) by D. Mihalas 1978 (out of print)
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Fundamentals of radiative transfer
2. Basic theory of radiation fields
3. Radiation from moving charges
4. Bremsstrahlung
5. Synchrotron radiation
6. Compton scattering
7. Plasma transfer effects
8. Radiative transitions
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)

科號  Course Number ：
11220ASTR640000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：宇宙論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Cosmology
任課教師  Instructor ：後藤友嗣
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course review our current understanding of the Universe with emphasis on the
observational
evidence and theoretical background of individual subjects. We will explore topics in the
geometry of the Universe, inflation, Big Bang, dark matter, dark energy and gravitational
lensing.
Our goal is to provide students with a summary of our current understanding of the
Universe,
and what topics remain to be explored. The material is presented
without complex mathematics as much as possible. Previous knowledge of general
relativity is
not required. At the beginning of each class, students are assigned to review the material
from the
previous week. This course will be offered in English. The use of AI is unrestricted use with
no disclosure required
⼆、課程內容  (Course Content)
: Introduction: Olbers' paradox, FRW Metric, Cosmological Parameters, Flatness problem.
: Cosmological distance measures, edge and fate of the Universe
: Cosmic microwave background I: Discovery, big bang nucleosynthesis.
: Cosmic microwave background II: Inflation.
: Cosmic microwave background III: Acoustic peaks, Sachs-Wolfe effect, reionization.
: Cosmic microwave background IV: Polarization, and primordial gravitational wave
: Dark energy I: Type Ia supernova, cosmic distance ladder
: Dark energy II: BAO, SZ effect. f_gas, cluster counts, redshift space distortion
: Three evidences of dark matter
: Gravitational lensing I: Einstein radius, surface brightness conservation, time delay
: Gravitational lensing II: odd number theorem, inverse magnification theorem, caustics
: Gravitational lensing III: Cosmic shear and its cosmological application
三、參考書籍  (References)
"Observational Cosmology" by Stephen Serjeant (Cambridge University Press, 2010)
"Accelerating Universe" by Dragan Huterer (http://arxiv.org/pdf/1010.1162v3.pdf)
"Dark Energy and Accelerating Universe" by Frieman et al.
(http://arxiv.org/pdf/0803.0982v1.pdf)
"Distance measures in Cosmology" by David Hogg
(http://arxiv.org/abs/astroph/9905116)
“Principles of Physical Cosmology” by P.J.E. Peebles (Princeton Uni- versity Press, 1993).
”Modern Cosmology” by S. Dodelson (Academic Press, 2003).
"An Introduction to Modern Cosmology 2nd ed." by Liddle. (Wiley)
”Cosmological Physics” by J.A. Peacock (Cambridge University Press, 1999).
”An Introduction to Cosmology” by J. Narlikar (Cambridge University Press, 2002).
”Spacetime and Geometry: An Introduction to General Relativity” by Sean M. Carroll
(Addison
Wesley,
2004).
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Attendance, assignments, review project, and final presentation.

評分標準：
1. 課程基本分為 85 分，發問  +3 ，曠課  -5 ，遲到  -1 ，請假不扣分
2. 學期末時依學校規定轉換為等級制 ( 例如 100~90 A+, 89~85 A, 84~80 A-)
3. 請假原則
(1) 不可抗拒之實驗因素，且經指導教授同意
(2) 病假需檢附相關證明
(3) 私⼈理由原則上不可請假，如有特殊情況請事先與授課教師討論
4. 請假⽅式 :

備註：
1. 每堂課前請記得線上或現場簽到； 10:30 之後則算遲到。
2. 線上課程會附上該次的 google 試算表連結，請同學於 10:20-10:30 簽到以完成點名。
3. 問答加分和簽到確認期限為⼀週（有問題須於下禮拜上課時間前與助教反應）。
Grading Criteria:
The basic course grade comprises 85 points. Additional points: +3 for participation, -5 for absence, -1 for
tardiness. No deductions for excused absences.
At the end of the semester, grades will be converted to the University's grading scale (e.g., 100-90 A+, 89-
85 A, 84-80 A-).
Leave Policy:
(1) Unavoidable experimental factors, with the approval of the supervising professor.
(2) Medical leave requires supporting documentation.
(3) Generally, personal reasons are not considered valid grounds for leave. For exceptional situations, it's
advisable to discuss in advance with Prof. Huang.
Absence Procedures:
(1) Notify Professor Huang via email, including copies to your advisor and the course TA.
(2) Ensure the notification email is sent at least one day prior to the class, except in cases of sudden illness
or unforeseen events.
Notes:
(1) Remember to check in online or in person before each class. Checking in after 10:30 a.m. will be
considered tardy.
(2) During online sessions, a Google Sheets link will be available for attendance between 10:20 a.m. and
10:30 a.m.
(3) Questions to earn bonus points and deadlines for confirming attendance are within a week. If you have
any concerns, please address them with the TA before the next class.

科號  Course Number ： 11220BME
503000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等醫材分析技術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Analytical Technologies
任課教師  Instructor ：萬德輝
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is divided into 2 semesters, including basic analytical theory (I) and instrumental analytical
methods (II). Semester Two introduces fundamental concepts of analytical chemistry with an emphasis on the
approaches based on instrumental measurements for bio-materials. Topics include Spectrochemical Analysis,
Mass Spectroscopy, Gas Chromatography, and Surface Characterization by Spectroscopy and Microscopy.
本⾨課將分為上下學期教授，涵蓋基礎分析化學理論 ( 上學期 ) 以及儀器分析⽅法 ( 下學期 ) ，並著重儀器
分析化學在⽣醫材料之應⽤實例。在下學期的課程中，將以介紹常⽤分析儀器為主軸，引導學⽣從邏
輯思考進⽽瞭解材料分析原理，同時增強學⽣應有的實驗理論，包含化學光譜分析、質譜、氣相層
析、表⾯鑑定技術，並針對⽣物材料進⾏其分析技術之介紹。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.D. A. Skoog, D. M. West, F. J. Holler, and S. R. Crouch, "Fundamentals of Analytical Chemistry", 9th Ed.,
Mary Finch.
2.A. Manz, N. Pamme, and D. Iossifidis, "Bioanalytical Chemistry", 2004, Wiley.

This course will consist of lecture topics, concept of laboratory technique and
periodic examinations. The overall emphasis will be made on basic biology and
medicine. The students are expected to develop a comprehensive understanding of
fundamental and modern development in biology. This course is designed for the
undergraduate students interested in life science and biomedicine even though
without biology background.

科號  Course Number ：
11220BMES323401學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣物與材料實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biology and Biomedical Materials Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：劉耕⾕
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 101 ／ 56
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is an experimental course for students interested in the application of
biology and biomedical materials in biomedical engineering related sciences. It
will teach the basic technique for conducting research in the fields of
biomedical
engineering sciences.
課程設計涵蓋兩個⾯向：
I ⽣醫材料：
(a)⽣化⼩分⼦與蛋⽩質⼤分⼦材料之製備與性質分析
(b)⽣物⾼分⼦與奈米粒⼦之製備與性質分析
II ⽣醫分析：
(a)材料與蛋⽩質之耦合分析
(b)材料與細胞之耦合分析
(c)細胞分析
課程精神為⽣醫分析可經由⽣醫材料的製備以進⾏⽣物系統的探索。

11220BMES325300學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：光學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Optics
任課教師  Instructor ：陳之碩
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3 上課教室  Room ：醫環 101 ／ 56
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1.Course Description:
This course aims to provide students an overview of fundamental optics and
related optical
applications in biomedical field.
It is a one-semester based introduction to optics.
In this class, we will essentially introduce geometrical optics and wave
optics.
In geometrical optics, ray-tracing, lens design, basic optical instruments
will be covered.
In wave optic, wave equations, interference, diffraction, image formation,
coherence, polarization will be discussed.
This course aims to provide students an overview of fundamental optics and to
introduce related optical applications in biomedical field.
2.Text Book: Introduction to Optics, Frank L. Pedrotti
3.Teaching Methods: 2 sections per week; one 2-hr section , and one 1-hr
section
4.Syllabus:
R26;Nature of Light
R26;Geometrical Optics
R26;Optical Instrumentation
R26;Wave Equations
R26;Superposition of Waves
R26;Interference of Light
R26;Optical Interferometry
R26;Coherence
R26;Fraunhofer Diffraction
R26;Fresnel Diffraction
R26;Light Polarization
5.Evaluation: Mid term I (30%), Mid term I (30%), Final Exam (30%),
Homework/quiz (10%)

11220BMES424400學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫⾼分⼦導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction of Biomedical Polymer
任課教師  Instructor ：胡尚秀
上課時間  Time ： W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is designed to provide background in basic polymer chemistry,
biomedical
polymer and recent advances in smart polymers for applications in
pharmaceutics,
biomaterials, tissue engineering and biotechnology.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
1. Charles E. Carraher, Jr., Polymer Chemistry 7/e.
2. J. S. Temenoff and A. G. Mikos, Biomaterials: The Intersection of Biology
and
Materials Science, Pearson, International Edition, 2008.
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. B. D. Ratner, Biomaterials Science, 3rd Ed., 2013.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Polymers
2. Polymer Structures: Introduction to polymers, Synthetic polymers, Natural
polymers
3. Polymer Syntheses: Addition (chain-growth) polymerization, Step-growth
polymerization, Ring-opening polymerization
4. Polymer Solution Properties: Dimension of an ideal polymer chain,
Statistical
thermodynamics of polymer solution, Dilute polymer solution, Frictional
property
5. Polymer Bulk Properties: Transition behaviors, Viscoelsticity and
mechanical
behavior, Rubber elasticity, Swelling theory of network polymer, Diffusion in
polymers
and hydrogels
6. Smart Polymers: Stimuli-sensitive polymers, Biodegradable polymers,
7. Polymers in Tissue Engineering and Cell Delivery
8. Soluble Drug Carriers/Polymeric Micelles: Polymeric soluble drug carrier,
Polymeric
micelles and nanoparticles
9. Polyelectrolytes
10. Polymers in Pharmaceutics: Polymers & macromolecules in controlled drug
delivery
11. Polymers in Biotechnology: Polymers in separation, Self-organizing
polymers
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
30% The 1st Midterm Exam, 30% The 2nd Midterm Exam, 30% Final Exam, 10% On-
class
discussion, 100% Total

中文名稱  Course Title ：全球暖化與環境衝擊
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Global Warming and Environmental Impact
任課教師  Instructor ：鍾堅  Chung Chien
上課時間  Time ： R7R8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 120 ／ 150
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀課程說明 (Course Description)
「聯合國氣候變化綱要公約」 (UNFCCC) 於 2023 年 11 ⽉第 28 屆峰會 (COP28) ，在阿聯酋杜拜重申落實
《巴黎
協定》 (Paris Agreement) 減碳救地球免於暖化威脅，唯減碳⾏動有共識卻毫無執⾏能⼒，僅期望於本
世紀
內的全球均溫較⼯業⾰命前增加幅度不得超過 1.5°C 。扣除⽬前因⼯業化排碳造成的全球暖化，較⼯業
⾰命前
的年均溫早已超過攝⽒ 1.2 ± 0.2°C ，到天花板只剩  0.3± 0.2°C 可揮霍。當下⼈類要達成完全沒約束⼒與
制
裁⼒的《巴黎協定》預想⽬標，除了德國與紐⻄蘭率先立法將於 2050 年達致⼯業淨零排碳外，對其它
各國
⾔，執政者僅議⽽不決、決⽽不⾏，⼯業碳中和幾乎是「不可能的任務」，⼈類只能⾯對排碳帶來⾃
食惡果的
全球暖化浩劫！
⼆ 指定⽤書與參考書籍 (Text Booksand References)
本課程未設指定教科書，課堂的電⼦講義，會側傳電⼦檔⾄校園學習資訊平台的
http://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw ，給修課同學上 eeclass 網站閱讀。
院環境部網站  http://www.epa.gov.tw
經濟部能源局網站  http://www.moeaboe.gov.tw
美國能源部資料局網站  http://www.eia.doe.gov;
聯合國跨政府氣候變遷研究團隊 (United Nation Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change,
UNIPCC) 2023 年 9 ⽉公佈 2022 年報 www.ipcc.ch/report/2022/

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The departmental colloquium is a research talk that is supposed to be accessible
to everyone who does research in BMES department, i.e. it will assume that you
have familiarity with all the basic ideas of the field that everyone in the
department ought to know, but not a specialized knowledge of the subfield that
the talk is about. It ought to be pitched at the level of a beginning graduate
student.

中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫光電基礎
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Fundamentals of Biophotonics
任課教師  Instructor ：陳之碩
上課時間  Time ： M2M3M4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 105 ／ 15
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1.Course Description:
The course aims to provide a multidisciplinary scope of biophotonics for
health
care. Basic knowledge is provided for students can rapidly acquire the minimal
necessary background for fundamental research, and a broad range of biomedical
applications will be discussed to strengthen the capacity of bioinstrument
development.
Couse starts from fundamental optics, including geometrical optics and wave
propagations. Basic cell biology is introduced from biophysical perspective.
Various microscopies (FREP, LSCM, optical tweezers), optical biosensors (SPR,
Fiber, fluorescence sensing), and photodynamic therapy in clinics will be
covered.
2.Reference Books:
R26;Introduction to Biophotonics, Paras N.Prasad
R26;Introduction to Optics, Frank L. Pedrotti
R26;Physical biology of the cell, Rob Phillips, Jane Kondev, Julie Theriot
3.Teaching Methods:
Lectures and discussions.
Student presentations are required
4.Syllabus:
1.Fundamentals of Light
2.Geometrical optics
3.Interference of Light
4.Basics of Biology
5.Equilibrium in the living cell
6.Random walks of Macromolecules
7.Mathematics of Water
8.Principle of Laser and laser technology
9.Bioimaging: Principle and Technology
10.Bioimaging : Applications
11.Optical biosensors
12.Biomedical instruments
13.Tissue engineering with light
5.Evaluation:
Mid term I (30%),
Final Project (70%),
科號  Course Number ：
11220BMES525100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：藥物控制釋放
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Drug Controlled Release
任課教師  Instructor ：邱信程
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 501 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
課⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is to provide the students an introduction to the fundamental
concepts of controlled drug delivery systems, types of drug carriers that have
been and/or are being developed and, particularly, detail descriptions in both the
preparation approaches and mechanisms of their actions to achieve drug controlled
delivery. For comprehensively understanding the rationales of drug delivery design
with desired biodistribution profiles, pharmacokinetics and biopharmaceutics are
partially introduced in this course.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
No textbooks
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. L. Shargel, A. B. C. Yu, Applied Biopharmaceutics and Pharmacokinetics, 2nd
Ed., ACC, 1985.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Concepts of drug controlled release (one week)
2. Nanomedicines for cancer treatments (six weeks)
3. Liposomes (three weeks)
4. Hydrogels (three weeks)
5. Transdermal and osmotic drug delivery devices (one week)
6. Pharmacokinetics (two weeks)
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)
45% Group Topic Proposal and Discussion
45% Final Exam
10% On-class general discussion
100% Total
七、採⽤下列何項  AI 使⽤規則  (Indicate which of the following options you use to
manage student use of the AI)
本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤  Not applicable
科號  Course Number ：
11220BMES526600學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫⾼分⼦應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Polymer for Bio-Applications
任課教師  Instructor ：胡尚秀
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
The aim of the course is to provide detailed knowledge of the structure,
function, properties and applications of biopolymers. Polymer Physics and
chemistry for some biological structures such as collagen, soft tissue, silk,
and artificial polymer is emphasized. The concept of nature as a model for
polymeric materials is discussed. Survey and introduction to biomedical
polymer including drug delivery, regenerative medicine, biosensor and other
bio-applications are conducted.
Maker Project!
Thinking design of a project: the students have to figure out the problems in
real life or situation, and design a simple "device or software or idea" to prove
the proto-type materials.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
1. B. D. Ratner, Biomaterials Science, 3rd Ed., 2013.
2. J. S. Temenoff and A. G. Mikos, Biomaterials: The Intersection of Biology
and Materials Science, Pearson, International Edition, 2008.
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. Charles E. Carraher, Jr., Polymer Chemistry 7/e.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Polymers
2. Polymer properties: transition behaviors, viscoelsticity and mechanical
behavior, rubber elasticity, swelling theory of network polymer, diffusion in
polymers and hydrogels
(~11 weeks)Maker Project!
3. Thinking design of a project: the students have to figure out the problems in
real life or situation, and design a simple "device or software or idea" to prove
the proto-type materials.

科號  Course Number ：
11220BMES531600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫電學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomedical Electronics
任課教師  Instructor ：王廷瑋
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 501 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course will provide students with an introduction to electrical knowledge that
is commonly used in biomedical engineering, including circuit, semiconductor
physics, microelectronics, and electromagnetism. The content includes the
principle of mentioned electrical knowledge and applications in biomedical
engineering. The main goal of this course is to help students thoroughly
understand the role of electrical knowledge in biomedical engineering from
principle to application. The content includes the microelectronic theorem that is
very adapted for students without prior electronics background, thus helping
students to perform multidisciplinary research in the future.
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and presentations.
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Circuit: circuit analysis
2. Microelectronics theorem: operation amplifier and filter
3. Semiconductor theorem: semiconductor physics and process
4. Microelectronics theorem: diode
5. Microelectronics theorem: bipolar junction transistor and field effect
transistor
6. Microelectronics theorem: single stage amplifier and multiple stage amplifier
7. Microelectronics biomedical application: ECG sensor and pulse rate circuit
四、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Participation (20%)
Classroom experiments (students work in groups on carefully designed guided
inquiry questions) (30%)
Final presentation (50%)

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Principles of Medical Ultrasonics
任課教師  Instructor ：葉秩光  Chih-Kuang Yeh
上課時間  Time ： M2M3M4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 419 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
objective: Introduce basic principles of diagnostic ultrasound imaging systems.
Clinical applications, design considerations and recent progress in the ultrasound
industry will also be discussed.
Textbook: 1. Class notes.
2. “Diagnostic Ultrasound Imaging: Inside Out” by Thomas L. Szabo, Elsevier
Academic Press, 2004.
Prerequisites: Mathematics
Topics:
1. Overview of Diagnostic Ultrasonic Imaging Systems.
2. Acoustic Wave Propagation.
3. Scattering, Attenuation and Speckle.
4. Transducers - Generation and Detection of Ultrasound.
5. Diffraction and Beam Formation Using Arrays.
6. Real-Time Image Formation.
7. Contrast Resolution.
8. Color and Spectral Doppler.
9. Doppler Ambiguity Function.
10. Ultrasound Contrast Agents.
Grading: 40% Computer Homework (Matlab Programming) and Experiments
30% Written Exam 1 (open book)
30% Written Exam 2 (open book)
Instructor: 葉秩光 PhD (BMES-421, E-mail: ckyeh@mx.nthu.edu.tw)

中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫訊號處理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomedical Signal Processing
任課教師  Instructor ：許靖涵
上課時間  Time ： R2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 501 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is an advanced course of digital signal processing with special emphasis on
their biomedical applications.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Richard Shiavi, Introduction to Applied Statistical Signal Analysis: Guide to
Biomedical and Electrical Engineering Applications, 3/e., Academic Press, 2007.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Ali H. Sayed, “Fundamentals of Adaptive Filtering,” Wiley, 2003.
2. Todd Moon, Wynn Stirling , “Mathematical Methods and Algorithms for
Signal Processing,” Prentice Hall, 2000.
3. Monson H. Hayes, “Statistical Digital Signal Processing and Modeling,”
Wiley, 1996.
4. Simon Haykin, “Adaptive Filter Theory,” 4/e Prentice Hall 2001.
5. Simon Haykin, “Neural Networks and Learning Machines,” 3/e, Prentice
Hall, 2008.
6. Steven Kay, “Fundamentals of Statistical Signal Processing, Volume I:
Estimation Theory,” Prentice Hall, 1993.
7. Steven Kay, “Fundamentals of Statistical Signal Processing: Detection
Theory, Volume 2,” Prentice Hall, 1998.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Deterministic signal processing: Empirical Modeling and Approximation, Fourier
Analysis
Statistical Signal Processing: Probability Concepts and Signal Characteristics,
Random Processes and Signal Correlation, Random Signals, Linear Systems, and
Power Spectra, Spectral Analysis for Random Signals, Random Signal Modeling and
Modern Spectral Estimation, Theory and Application of Cross Correlation and
Coherence.
Other Advanced Topics (If time permitted)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. Weekly homework (including computer programming): 50%
2. Midterm (Apr 11) and Final Exam (June 06): 25% + 25%

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is introductory course of deep learning and its applications to
biomedical imaging.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Ian Goodfellow and Yoshua Bengio and Aaron Courville, Deep Learning. MIT Press,
2016. (http://www.deeplearningbook.org/)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Daniel A. Roberts, Sho Yaida, Boris Hanin, The Principles of Deep
Learning Theory, Cambridge University Press, 2022.
(https://arxiv.org/abs/2106.10165)
2. C. M. Bishop, Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning. Springer, 2006.
(https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/people/cmbishop/#!prml-book)
3. Keras. https://keras.io/
4. PyTorch. https://pytorch.org/
5. Stuart Russell and Peter Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern
Approach, 4-th Ed., Pearson, 2020.
6. Richard S. Sutton and Andrew G. Barto, Reinforcement Learning: An
Introduction, MIT Press, 2018.
7. Haykin, Simon, Neural Networks and Learning Machines, 3rd. Ed., Pearson,
2016.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction, Python, Keras (PyTorch), Anaconda, Google Colab.
2. Perceptron and Neural Networks.
3. Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs).
4. Descent Optimization Algorithms, Normalzations.
5. Notable CNNs: LeNet, AlexNet, VGG 16 + 19, GoogleNet
6. object Detection: R-CNN
7. Residual CNN
8. Autoencoder, Generative Adversarial Networks
9. Denoising
10. Segmentation Using U-NET
11. Transformers (Attention Is All You Need)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. Homeworks 40%
2. Project 60%

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course description:
This course is designed for graduate students to learn how to present scientific
projects. Students are expected to select specific scientific topic and present
the research topics with PowerPoint or other preferred styles.
Teaching Method:
Oral presentation:
Every student has to deliver a 12 min presentation and 3 min Q&A in this
course. Please select research papers/reviews based on your research interests.
Report:
Before the presentation, please upload the papers with presentation slides by
Tuesday 23:00.
Grades:
Oral Presentation: 60%
Report: 20%
Participation: 20% (Ask 2 questions at least.)

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is designed for undergraduate students how to make a speech and
preside in the presentation including speech performance and PowerPoint slides
preparation. Every student presents once in this course and serves as a
chairman in turn.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No textbook assigned.
三、參考書籍 (References)
None.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Oral Presentation:
Present papers or research progress.
Chairman:
Collect information of speaker before class to introduce speaker, elicit
question, and handle time and audiences response in class.
Report by PowerPoint file:
Please hand in your PowerPoint file before Monday 5:00 PM by email.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)

11220BMES711200學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：專題書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：俞鐘⼭  YU CHUNG SHAN
上課時間  Time ： W6 上課教室  Room ：醫環 110 ／ 72
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Graduate students are presenting orally to attract the audiences' attention to
be willing to involving in the topic. Students are thus able to communicate
freely with others in a manner of science- or technology-based understandings.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
From Papers or research works
三、參考書籍 (References)
The same as above
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1. Two-hour lecture is provided by graduate student (s) for each week.
2. Topic： None specified, could be interesting and should be personal resarch-,
science- or technology-oriented contents such as paper works from SCI-indexed
journals for example. Contents with a certain depth in science are welcome.
3. Presentation should be within 20 mins and Q&A about 5-10 min depending on
the participants.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Will be anounced in the first class
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Grading is based on the presentation, the feedback by the audiences, quality of
the slides and the enrichment of scientific essence. Details including outline,
presentation skill, originality of the references, Q&A and time control will be
considered also.

Artificial intelligence is not applicable to the present course.

⽤於演算法開發、資料視覺化、資料分析以及數值計算的進階技術計算語⾔和互動式環境，被廣泛

中文名稱  Course Title ：化⼯單操
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chemical Engineering Unit Operations
任課教師  Instructor ：汪上曉  David Shan Hill Wong
上課時間  Time ： T1T2F2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  211 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將介紹如何應⽤化學⼯程科學之原理（如質能結算、熱⼒學及輸送現象）分析及設計實際
化⼯製程單元操作。內容包括：
[1] 動量傳送操作如：泵、壓縮機、管件、管路、攪拌槽，
[2] 多階平衡及質傳操作如：蒸餾、吸收、萃取、吸附、層析，
[3] 熱傳及熱質傳操作如：熱交換器、蒸發、乾燥。
能⼒訓練重點為：
[1] 尺度分析及放⼤設計能⼒、
[2] 蒐集數據能⼒、
[3] 使⽤電腦輔助設計軟體如 ASPEN Plus, DYNOCHEM 能⼒、
[4] 納入安全係數能⼒、遵守⼯程標準能⼒、
[5] 計劃管理，團隊協作能⼒
[6] 報告，溝通及英語能⼒
This course shall introduce the application of fundamental principles of
chemical engineering such as material and energy balance, thermodynamics,
transport phenomena to design chemical process unit operation equipment.
Actual operations that will be covered include
[1] momentum transfer operations such as pump, compressors, piping, piping
network, agitation tank;
[2] multistage equilibrium and mass transfer operations such as:
distillation,absorption, extraction, adsorption and chromatography,
[3] heat and heat transfer operations such as heat exchangers, evaportaion and
drying.
Training focuses will be on students' abilities:
[1] to do dimensional analysis and scaleup,
[2] to collect necessary information and data,
[3] to use computer aided design software such as ASPEN Plus,
[4] to include reasonable safety margins and conform to engineering standards,
[5] to work as a team and present results effectively,
[6] to present results, communicate with peers and superiors , and speak
English.
⼆、指定⽤書與參考資料 (Text Books and references)
相關講義、投影片、習題及其他參考資料將在 elearn 系統提供；無指定課本。常⽤參考書如
後。
The course has no assigned textbook. Lecture notes, powerpoint slides,
homework problems and other reference materials are made available on elearn
system. Common reference books are listed below.
"Unit Operations of Chemical Engineering", 6th edition, W.L. McCabe, J.C.
Smith
and P. Harriot, 2001 (McGraw-Hill International Edition)
"Chemical Engineering", vol. 2, 4th ed., Coulson and Richardson, Pergamon,
Oxford,
(1991).
"Transport Processes and Unit Operations", Geankoplis, Prentice-Hall, (1993).

五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
動量傳送操作：泵、壓縮機、管件、管路、攪拌槽
Momentum transfer operations: pump,compressor,piping,piping network,agitation
tank
多階平衡及質傳操作：蒸餾、吸收、萃取、吸附、層析
Multistage equilibrium and mass transfer operations: distillation, absorption,
extraction, absorption, adsorption and chromatography
熱傳及熱質傳操作：熱交換器、蒸發、乾燥
Heat transfer and heat and mass transfer operation: heat exchanger,
evaporation, and drying

353001學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
35
中文名稱  Course Title ：輸送現象及單元操作⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Transport Phenomena and Unit Operations(II)
任課教師  Instructor ：黃振煌
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course content focuses on the theory and related operations of heat transport
and mass transport. Heat transport part, including: conduction, convection and
radiation. The unit operations related to heat transfer are then introduced,
including: boiling and condensation, evaporation, and heat transfer equipment.
The mass transport part includes: diffusive mass transport and convective mass
transport. Next, the unit operations of mass transport are described, including
absorption and air stripping, humidity conditioning and cooling water,
distillation, extraction, drying, crystallization, and membrane separation.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Bird, R.B., W.E. Stewart, and E.N. Lightfoot, "Transport Phenomena," Revised 2nd
ed., Wiley (2007)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. 王茂齡 , “ 輸送現象 ” ⾼立圖書  (1993)
2. Stanley & Middleman, “An Introduction to Fluid Dynamics,” Wiley (1998).
3. R.B. Bird, W.E. Stewart, E.N. Lightfoot, and D.J. Klingenberg, “Introductory
Transport Phenomena”, 1st ed., Wiley (2015)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
投影片講解
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
ENERGY TRANSPORT (Chapter 9-16)
- Thermal Conductivity and the Mechanisms of Energy Transport.
- Shell Energy Balances and Temperature Distributions in Solids and Laminar Flow.
- The Equations of Change for Nonisothermal Systems.
- Temperature Distributions with More than One Independent Variable.
- Temperature Distributions in Turbulent Flow.
- Interphase Transport in Nonisothermal Systems.
- Macroscopic Balances for Nonisothermal Systems.
- Energy Transport by Radiation.
MASS TRANSPORT (Chapter 17-24)
- Diffusivity and the Mechanisms of Mass Transport.
- Concentration Distributions in Solids and Laminar Flow.
- Equations of Change for Multicomponent Systems.
- Concentration Distributions with More than One Independent Variable.
- Concentration Distributions in Turbulent Flow.
- Interphase Transport in Nonisothermal Mixtures.
- Macroscopic Balances for Multicomponent Systems.
- Other Mechanisms for Mass Transport.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework 15%
Mid-term Exam. 30%
Final Exam. 30%
Final Presentation 15%
Class Discussion 10%

中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦構裝技術與材料
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronic Packaging technology and materials
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信文
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Electronic packaging is to connect integrated circuits and other electronic
components together in a system so that the designed functions of the system can
be performed. The electronic packaging industry belongs to the latter part of
the electronic industry, and is interdependent with the integrated circuit
manufacturing industry. This course introduces the manufacturing processes and
materials used in electronic packaging, so that students have an understanding
of the field of electronic packaging. In the future, students can use this
foundation, plus their own original expertise, as the starting point for entry
and contribution to the field of electronic industry.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
電⼦構裝材料與技術，陳信文、陳立軒、林永森、陳志銘，⾼立圖書， 2004

課堂講授

1. Introduction of electronic packaging
2. Silicon wafer, Integrated circuites manufacturing
3. Types of first level packaging, Cutting, Die bonding
5. Wire bonding
6. Leadframes
7. Transfer molding and molding compounds (I)
8. Transfer molding and molding compounds (II)
9. Midterm examination
10. Stamping, forming
10. Liquid encapsulant
11. Ceramic packaging
12. Ceramic packaging
13. Printed circuit board(I)
14. Printed circuit board (II)
15. Electronic soldeirng (I)
15. Electronic soldering (II)
16. Electronic propertied and heat transfer
17. FCP 、 BGA 、 CSP
18. Final examination

中文名稱  Course Title ：光電材料與元件基礎
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Fundamentals of Optoelectronic Materials and Devices
任課教師  Instructor ：段興宇
林昆翰
上課時間  Time ： M7M8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
ChE 4940 Fundamentals of Optoelectronic Materials and Devices
(光電材料與元件基礎  2 學分 )
課程說明 :
教育化⼯系的同學，使認識光電材料與光電元件的基礎及其製程，俾便未來運⽤化學⼯程技術在這
些相關的產業之中。內容主要分為三⼤部分 : 光電材料與元件基本原理 , 無機光電材料與元件、有
機光電材料與元件。
Educate students in Department of Chemical Engineering to understand the basis
of optoelectronic materials and optoelectronic components and the processing,
enabling the future use of chemical engineering related industries.
The contents were divided into three parts: the basic principle of
optoelectronic materials and components, inorganic optoelectronic materials
and components. Organic optoelectronic materials and components.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
CHE 500200 分⼦⼯程⼆ (Molecular Engineering (II))
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程與《分⼦⼯程 ( ⼀ ) 》為⼯學院分⼦⼯程學程碩⼠班必修課 , 將本學程四⼤重點 ( 超分⼦結構
調控、分⼦光電、分⼦流變與精密加⼯、分⼦模擬 ) 做綜合性的介紹，使同學們對分⼦⼯程有全
⾯性的暸解，作為培養跨學⾨性質的⾼階研發⼈才的基礎；其中《分⼦⼯程 ( ⼀ ) 》涵括量⼦原
理與光電性質，《分⼦⼯程 ( ⼆ ) 》則著重於分⼦設計、奈米材料與結構製程、能源轉換技術、元件製
作
(bottom-up
and top-down) 。
Molecular Engineering (I) and (II) are the required courses for the master program
of
Molecular Engineering Program in the College of Engineering. The comprehensive
contents of this course are to introduce the four points, control structure for
super
molecular, photoconductive molecular, molecular rheology with precision machining
and
molecular simulation. The course aims to integrate talents of students from
various,
particularly the molecular engineering science then develop the basis of the
interdisciplinary or R & D talent. Molecular Engineering (I) includes Quantum
principle and
photoconductive properties. Molecular Engineering (II) is major Molecular design,
nanometer material,
nanometer structure process, energy conversion technology, and device fabrication
from bottom-up and top-
down.
⼆、參考書籍 (References)
International science journals

546500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等⾼分⼦物理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics in Condensed Polymer Physics
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信龍
上課時間  Time ： R2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The connectivity and collective behavior of monomers give rise to intriguing
properties that set polymers apart from small molecules. Polymer physics is a
specialized field within polymer science that concentrates on the study of the
structure, dynamics, and physical properties of polymers. The structures observed
in polymers within the experimental time scale are typically metastable and
exhibit distinctive features across a wide spectrum of length scales. Therefore,
comprehending the fundamental thermodynamic and kinetic principles governing the
structure formation is crucial for controlling and designing the hierarchical
structures and properties of polymers aiming for practical applications as well
as developing novel functional materials.
This course is designed to impart the fundamental concepts of polymer physics
to students. We will commence with an exploration of single-chain behavior and
gradually delve into the topics including polymer solution thermodynamics, glass
transition, self-assembly behavior, viscoelasticity, and dynamics. Additionally,
we will briefly touch upon the application of small-angle scattering techniques
in the analysis of polymer nanostructures. The goal of this course is to provide
students from diverse backgrounds with a foundational understanding of polymer
physics that can serve as a stepping stone to grasp the intricacies of the
processing-structure-property relationship and the mechanisms dictating the
morphological formation of polymers.
本課程主要講解⾼分⼦的基本物理特性，內容包括： (1) ⾼分⼦鏈構形統計⼒學、 (2) ⾼分⼦溶液熱
⼒學、 (3) ⾼分⼦玻璃轉化現象、 (4) ⾼分⼦結晶形態學、 (5) ⾼分⼦結晶熱⼒學與動⼒學、 (6) ⾼分
⼦黏彈性。
This course will cover the essential concepts for understanding the physical
properties of polymers. Specific topics to be covered include (1) conformational
statistics of single chain, (2) polymer solution thermodynamics, (3) glass
transition, (4) polymer crystallization, and (5) viscoelasticity.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1.⾼分⼦物理講義  (Lecture notes)
2.M. Rubintein Grand R. H. Colby, Polymer Physics, Oxford.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. G Strobl, The Physics of Polymer
2. Sperling, Introduction to Physical Polymer Science
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture 3/4; Discussion secession 1/4
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
(1)⾼分⼦鏈構形統計⼒學  conformational statistics of single chain
(2)⾼分⼦溶液熱⼒學  polymer solution thermodynamics
(3)⾼分⼦玻璃轉化現象  glass transition
(1)⾼分⼦結晶形態學  morphology of crystallie polymers
(2)⾼分⼦結晶熱⼒學與動⼒學  crystallization thermodynamics and kinetics of polymers
(3)⾼分⼦黏彈性  viscoelasticity
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Mid term exam: 50%
Final exam: 50%

科號  Course Number ： 11220CHE
555000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
20
中文名稱  Course Title ：膠體界⾯科學與科技特論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Colloid and Interface Science & Technology
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡德豪
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  211 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
The course is designed to provide basic understanding of colloid and interface
science for students with interests of nanomaterial-manufactured products and
their applications in the fields of chemical engineering. The objective is
to
understand the physical and chemical properties of nanomaterial dispersions,
and then to bridge the knowledge of their synthesis and surface chemistry to
the recent developments of nanotechnology and bionantechnology.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
R26; John C. Berg, “An Introduction to Interfaces & Colloids: The Bridge to
Nanoscience”, World Scientific, 2010
三、參考書籍 (References)
R26; W. B. Russel, D. A. Saville, W. R. Schowalter, “Colloidal
Dispersions”, Cambridge University Press, Mar 26, 1992
R26; Martin J. Rhodes, “Introduction to Particle Technology”, 2nd Edition,
Wiley 2008
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
During the semester, we will be going through the following topics in order:
1. Introduction of colloid and interface science
2: Phenomenology of colloidal systems
3. Synthesis and characterization of colloidal systems
4. Interactions between colloid particles
5. Emulsion and foaming
6. Overview: the applications to nanotechnology and bionanotechnology
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Will be announced in the first class
本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤  (This course is not related to the restriction in the AI usage)
科號  Course Number ： 11220CHE
575000學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：材料相平衡
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Phase Equilibria of Materials
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信文
上課時間  Time ： M1M2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The objective of this course is understanding the principles and
applications of
multi-component phase equilibria of materials. The topics include phase
diagrams
of one, two and three component systems, thermodynamic principles governing
phase
equilibria, liquidus projection and applications of phase equilibria.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
F. N. Rhines, “Phase diagrams in metallurgy: their development and
application”,
McGraw-Hill, 1956.
三、參考書籍 (References)
D. R. Gaskell, “Introduction to metallurgical Thermodynamics”, 2nd edition,
McGraw-Hill, 1981.
N. Saunders, A. P. Miodownik, “Calphad, Calculation of Phase Diagrams a
Comprehensive Guide”, Elsevier Science 1998
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1 Introduction, Unary systems, Binary isomorphous systems
Week 2 Eutectic, Eutectoid
Week 3 Monotectic, metatectic, Peritectic
Week 4 Intermediate phases, Congruent, Peritectoid, Syntectic
Week 5 Complex binary systems, Schreinemakers Rule
Week 6 Determination of phase diagrams
Week 7 Gibbs-Duhem equation, Tangent rule
Week 8 Phase diagram calculation (Binary)
Week 9 Mid-term exam
Week 10 Ternary isomorphous systems, isothermal section, isopleths
Week 11 Ternary three-phase equilibrium
Week 12 Class I reaction
Week 13 Class II reaction
Week 14 Class III reaction
Week 15 Liquidus projection
Week 16 Congruent transformation in ternary systems
Week 17 Phase diagram calculation (multi-component)
Week 18 Final exam
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Quiz, Homework (15%)
Mid-term exam (40%)
Final exam (45%)

科號  Course Number ：
11220CHEM222001學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
100
中文名稱  Course Title ：有機化學⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Chemistry (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：陳建添
上課時間  Time ： T1T2F1F2 上課教室  Room ：化⼆  223 ／ 109
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
延續有機化學⼀將針對 : ⾃由基和烷烴的反應、質譜 / 紅外線 / 紫外可⾒光光譜學、核磁共振、羧酸及其
衍⽣物的反應、醛與酮的反應、在羰基化合物的 α- 碳上的反應、苯的反應和胺類來做系統性介紹。
Textbook:
Organic Chemistry Seventh Edition by Paula Yurkanis Bruice (8th Ed)
Ref tool: Chem Draw and Chem 3D
Teaching Method: Both ppt presentation and lit ref as well as Chem Draw and Chem
3D.
Topics:
1. Radicals. Reactions of Alkanes (2 week)
2. MS, IR, UV-Vis (2 weeks)
3. NMR (2 weeks)
4. Reactions of Carboxylic Acids and Derivatives (2 weeks)
5. Reactions of Aldehydes and Ketones (2 weeks)
6. Reactions at the alpha-Carbon of Carbonyl Compounds (3 weeks)
7. Reactions of Benzenes (3 weeks)
8. More about amines (2 weeks)
Evaluation and Score policy:
1st term exam: March 22 or 26 (Friday or Tue): 25%
2nd term exam: April 26 or 30 (Friday or Tue): 25%
3rd term exam: May 24 (Friday): 25%
Final exam: June 14 (Friday): 25%
The contents in handouts, exercises, and problems account for about 85% of the
questions in the exams.
Attendance check: 2 points each, 5 times.
本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤
科號  Course Number ：
11220CHEM222002學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
160
中文名稱  Course Title ：有機化學⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Chemistry (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：王聖凱
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  B18 ／ 160
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
基礎有機化學，增進同學在有機化學的認識。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Bruice, P. Y.; "Organic Chemistry" 8th Ed., Pearson, 2017. ( 偉明圖書代理 )
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
PowerPoint
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Radicals
2. Mass Spectrometry and IR, UV/Vis spectroscopy
3. Nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
4. Carboxylic acids and derivatives
5. Aldehydes and ketones
6. Carbonyl compounds
7. Benzene and derivatives
8. Amines
9. Extra materials
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
⼆次期中考及期末考各佔  1/3.
本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤  Not applicable
科號  Course Number ：
11220CHEM224001學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
33
中文名稱  Course Title ：有機化學實驗⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Chemistry Laboratory (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：林芳齡
上課時間  Time ： M5M6
M7M8上課教室  Room ：化  326 ／ 65
化 324／ 36
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
實驗課程：
(實驗順序暫定 )
1. Oxidation reaction
2. Reduction of Fluorenone
3. Suzuki Cross Coupling
4. Catalytic Hydrogenation
5. Witting Reaction
6. Aldol condensation
7. Luminol Synthesis
部分實驗需 IR 、 NMR 分析
參考書籍：
K. L. Williamson and K. M. Masters Macroscale and Microscale Organic Experiments,
7th Ed

科號  Course Number ：
11220CHEM292000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：化學數學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Mathematics for Chemistry
任課教師  Instructor ：周佳駿
上課時間  Time ： M1M2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：化⼆  223 ／ 109
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
No textbook is required for this course. Notes will be the primary source.
References:
1. Erich Steiner, The Chemistry Maths Book, 2nd edition, (2008).
2. Donald A. McQuarrie, Mathematics for Physical Chemistry, 1st edition, (2008).
3. Donald A. McQuarrie, Mathematical Methods for Scientists and Engineers, 1st edition, (2003).
4. K. F. Riley and M. P. Hobson, Foundation Mathematics for the Physical Sciences, 1st edition, (2011).
5. K. F. Riley and M. P. Hobson, Essential Mathematical Methods for the Physical Sciences, 1st edition,
(2011).
6. George F. Simmons, Differential Equations with Applications and Historical Notes, 3rd edition, (2016).
7. Donald A. McQuarrie and John D. Simon, Physical Chemistry: A Molecular Approach, 1st edition, (1997).
8. F. Albert Cotton, Chemical Applications of Group Theory, 3rd edition, (1990).
Course Prerequisites:
Calculus I, Calculus II, and Applied Mathematics.
Course objectives:
This course is a continuation of CHEM2930 Applied Mathematics. It covers a variety of topics in applied
mathematics. The main topics include systems of ordinary differential equations, Fourier series, integral
transforms, partial differential equations, and molecular symmetry. The goal is to prepare students for
advanced studies in all areas of science and engineering. Examples will be drawn from a variety of scientific
and mathematical areas.
Course Outline (topics to be covered and order of presentation subject to change):
1. Brief review of ordinary differential equations
2. Higher-order ordinary differential equations
3. Systems of first-order ordinary differential equations
4. Fourier series and orthogonal expansion
5. Integral transforms: the Laplace and Fourier transforms
6. Partial differential equations
7. Molecular symmetry and group theory
Course Grades:
Homework (10%);
3 Exams: Exam 1 (30%); Exam 2 (30%); Exam 3 (30%)
科號  Course Number ：
11220CHEM312000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：分析化學⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Analytical Chemistry (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：鄂本帕偉
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：化  B07 ／ 105
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Contents (by topic):
1. Introduction
2. Electronic components and circuits
3. Signal processing
4. Atomic absorption spectroscopy
5. Atomic emission spectroscopy
6. * Mid-term exam I
7. Molecular absorption spectroscopy
8. Molecular emission spectroscopy
9. Infrared spectroscopy
10. Atomic mass spectrometry
11. Molecular mass spectrometry
12. * Mid-term exam II
13. Gas chromatography
14. Liquid chromatography
15. Electrophoresis
16. Automated methods of analysis
17. * Final exam
Evaluation:
* The final score will be based on the scores obtained from quizzes (20%),
midterm exams (40%), and final exam (40%).
Requirements:
Students who have completed Analytical Chemistry I can attend this course.
Study material:
Handouts will be provided for selected topics.
Main textbook:
D.A. Skoog, F.J. Holler, S.R. Crouch, Principles of Instrumental Analysis, 7th
Edition, 2017, Cengage.
Other references will be cited in the handouts and/or slides displayed on the
screen.
Office hour:
Time: Friday, 14:00-15:00.
Place: room 308
Ethics Statement on Generative Artificial Intelligence
After careful consideration, the instructor of this course deems it
inappropriate to use generative artificial intelligence in this class. This is
because the content within generative AI contains numerous errors and may
adversely affect students' understanding of foundational knowledge. In
accordance with the published Guidelines for Collaboration, Co-learning, and
Cultivation of Artificial Intelligence Competencies in University Education,
this course adopts the following policy : Prohibited use
Students enrolled in this course should be aware that they may not submit
assignments, reports, or personal reflections generated using artificial
intelligence. If such usage is discovered, instructors, the institution, or
relevant units have the right to reevaluate the assignment or report or withhold
scores. Students enrolled in this course agree to the above ethics statement if
registering for the class.

科號  Course Number ：
11220CHEM329001學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
33
中文名稱  Course Title ：光譜分析實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Spectroscopic Analysis Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：陳建添
上課時間  Time ： T5
T6T7T8上課教室  Room ：化  326 ／ 65
化 324／ 36
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description: Will focus on synthetic skill training and instruction.
Isolation and purification of final products by column chromatography and/or re-
crystallization. proton, carbon-13, 2-D correlation NMR analysis to characterize
the structures. 31P NMR will also be taken.
Text Books: literature references will be give.
Teaching Method: ppt and pdf presentation about the experiments.
Simple demonstration of Chem Draw and Chem 3D and SciFinder search use.
Syllabus:
A total of 4-5 experiments will be carried out, which include the followings:
(1) methyl 2-vinylbenzoate: synthesis and spectroscopic
assignment
(2) diethyl (E)-(2-bromostyryl)phosphonate: synthesis and spectroscopic
assignment
(3) methyl (E)-2-hydroxy-4-phenylbut-3-enoate: synthesis and spectroscopic
assignment
(4) 1,2-diphenylcyclopropan-1-ol: synthesis and spectroscopic assignment
(5) 4,6-bis((4S,5S)-4,5-diphenyl-4,5-dihydrooxazol-2-yl)dibenzo[b,d]furan:
synthesis and spectroscopic assignment
Nucleophilic addition, acyl substitution, nucleophilic substitution, Michael type
conjugate addition, and Claisen condensation reactions will be covered.
Their synthetic steps are attached in a separate pdf file.
Evaluation:
Experimental skills: 60%
Product yield: 40%
Assignment: 100%.
Total 200 points for each experiments.
本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤

科號  Course Number ：
11220CHEM453000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：有機反應與合成
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Reactions and Syntheses
任課教師  Instructor ：汪炳鈞  UANG BIING JIUN
上課時間  Time ： T2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：化  326 ／ 65
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將介紹基本的有機合成⽅法及其反應機理，以⼀些結構上具代表性的天然產物及理論上具特殊
意
義的有機分⼦為標的物，討論有機合成的策略及⽅法。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
"Modern Organic Synthesis; An Introduction"
George S. Zweifel, Michael H. Nantz and Peter Somfai Ed., 2nd ed, Wiley.

中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論⼆ ( 物化分析組 )
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar-Physical and Analytical Chemistry (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：鄂本帕偉
上課時間  Time ： R5R6 上課教室  Room ：化  121 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
The course participants will be asked to read selected scientific papers, and to
present them in the class. The presentation will be followed by a discussion.
Final score will be based on the following items:
- Pre-discussion (10%)
- Abstract (10%)
- Presentation in the class (50%)
- Response to questions and feedback (20%)
- Providing feedback to presenter (10%)
- Participation in the discussion (additional points)
Maximum score: 100
Every participant should find a review paper on an important topic related to
contemporary research in analytical or physical chemistry chemistry. Further on,
one should find 1-3 original papers on this topic published recently in the
journals with the impact factor higher than 3. One should then discuss these
papers with the teacher 2-4 weeks before the scheduled presentation.
The presenter should circulate the abstract of the presentation not later than
one day before the presentation. The abstract should be in one A4 page. Include
the key references following the ACS formatting style.
The presentation slides should be clear. Include high-quality diagrams and short
statements to facilitate understanding. Rehearse your presentation in advance to
communicate the scientific content properly.
After the presentation, you will receive written feedback from the course
participants. You should provide a written response to this feedback within one
week (to the teacher and other participants).
Every participant must provide written feedback to the presenters. Moreover,
every participant must ask at least 3 questions during the discussion. Up to 6
points will be deducted if this requirement is not met. One can gain up to 10
additional points for asking further questions.
It is compulsory to attend every class. In case of sickness, one can skip up to
two classes. An official certificate from a hospital needs to be provided. Any
other absence will result in deduction of 5 points (every time).
Teacher:
Prof. Pawel Urban
Chemistry Building, room 308
e-mail: urban@mx.nthu.edu.tw
website: http://www.UrbanLab.tw
Ethics Statement on Generative Artificial Intelligence
After careful consideration, the instructor of this course deems it
inappropriate to use generative artificial intelligence in this class. This is
because the content within generative AI contains numerous errors and may
adversely affect students' understanding of foundational knowledge. In
accordance with the published Guidelines for Collaboration, Co-learning, and
Cultivation of Artificial Intelligence Competencies in University Education,
this course adopts the following policy : Prohibited use
Students enrolled in this course should be aware that they may not submit
assignments, reports, or personal reflections generated using artificial
intelligence. If such usage is discovered, instructors, the institution, or
relevant units have the right to reevaluate the assignment or report or withhold
scores. Students enrolled in this course agree to the above ethics statement if
registering for the class.

11220CHEM501500學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
50
中文名稱  Course Title ：同步輻射應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applications of Synchrotron Radiation
任課教師  Instructor ：李耀昌
上課時間  Time ： R7R8 上課教室  Room ：化  326 ／ 65
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 :
同步輻射光源是廿⼀世紀尖端科學研究的實驗利器之⼀，在化學、物理、半導體材料、⽣醫與醫學
檢測、綠⾊能源材料、古⽣物、地質與環保、微機械等基礎及應⽤科學研究，世界各國也因⽽紛紛
完成或興建不同電⼦能量的同步加速器產⽣更寬廣、強度更強及同調性更佳的同步輻射光源，⽬前
已有利⽤同步輻射光源建構⽽成的 X 光⾃由電⼦雷射（ X-ray Free Electron Laser, XFEL ）進
⾏更尖端的科學研究。在亞太洲地區台灣、⽇本（有 11 座同步輻射設施，其中以⼤型同步輻射
設施 Spring 8 及⾃由電⼦雷射設施，另外即將於北海道⼤學校園興建⼀座新的同步輻射加速器
光源）、韓國（浦項加速器實驗室及⾃由電⼦雷射設施 PAL-XFEL ）、中國⼤陸（北京、上海及
合肥）、泰國、新加坡、澳洲、約旦及印度均有⼤型同步輻射加速器光源的研究設施進⾏尖端的
研究。
本課程的主要⽬標在於帶領年輕學⼦認識在全球科技的競爭中，同步輻射光源的尖端科學研究及
應⽤扮演著非常重要的⾓⾊，藉由本課程的教學希望年輕學⼦能認識同步輻射光源為科學研究的
重要⼯具之⼀，希望未來能利⽤同步輻射光源做出影響深遠的重⼤科學發現。
● 參考書籍 (References)
1. A Guide to Synchrotron Radiation Science, Ed. by: M. Watanabe, S.
Sato, I. Munro, and G. S. Lodha, Narosa Publishing House (2016).
2. Synchrotron Radiation: Basics, Methods and Applications, S. Mobilio,
F. Boscherini, C. Meneghini (Eds.), Springer (2015).
3. Chemical Applications of Synchrotron Radiation (Part I: Dynamics and
VUV Spectroscopy; Part II: X-Ray Applications), edited by T.-K. Sham, World
Scientific (2002).
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
每個主題教學會邀請同步輻射研究中⼼在不同領域專⻑的研究⼈員以簡報及互動的⽅式進⾏講
授。

科號  Course Number ：
11220CHEM534000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：固態化學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Solid State Chemistry
任課教師  Instructor ：黃暄益
上課時間  Time ： T3T4F2 上課教室  Room ：化  125 ／ 73
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces inorganic materials in the solid state. Topics to be
discussed include the methods of inorganic materials synthesis, crystal
structures, bonding in solids, structural characterization techniques, and
optical, electrical and magnetic properties of solid materials. Facet-dependent
electrical, photocatalytic, organic catalytic, magnetic, piezoelectric and
optical properties of semiconductor crystals are also presented.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Solid State Chemistry An Introduction, 4th edition by Lesley E. Smart and Elaine
A. Moore, CRC Press or "Basic Solid State Chemistry" by Anothony R. West or
"Solid State Chemistry and its Applications" by the same author.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
The lectures are delivered by PowerPoint presentations. The lecture may be
delivered in English if there are foreign students.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Syllabus will be more or less followed as outlined in the course description
section and will be given before the first day of classes. There will be one
midterm exam and one final exam. Students are expected to study the presented
materials. Reading of some mentioned literature articles is encouraged.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Class evaluation will be based mostly on the exam grades. Attendance may be
considered in the determination of the final grade.

課程說明 (Course Description)
⼝頭報導及討論有機化學領域之重要近期文獻。
1. 原則上每⽇ 3 ⼈，每⼈  1 + 20 + 4 min ( 視實際情形更動）；  1 分鐘介紹， 20 分鐘報告，
4分鐘問答及講評，時間嚴格控制。
2. 每⽇第 n 位演講， n + 3 位擔任主持⼈，並負責點名、收集題⽬卷及控制時間。
3. 第⼀次不出席不扣分，以後每次扣 5 分。
4. 演講者著正式服裝：
男同學打領帶、穿⽪鞋、襯衫。
女同學不可穿著⽜仔褲、短褲、涼鞋。
5. 正常情況下，分數約在 70–95 分間。
6. 題⽬、內容、 Reference 依所附範例製備，演講當⽇  交于第  n + 3 位同學。
型式依 ACS style Guide 。
7. 每位每學期⾄少提出問題三次，並交回問卷，缺⼀次扣五分。
8. 全勤加 3 分，最⾼不超過 98 分。
9. 如遇延期狀況，依序順延。
10. 主要之 paper 需為最近 2 年內發表，但不可是回顧性文章。
11. 題⽬⾃訂，但非發表文章之題⽬，且不可抄襲。
以上各點會依據實際上課狀況修改。

每次⼆到三名，每⼈演講時間 30 or 40 分鐘，並預留⾄少五分鐘供學術討論。

討
論的效果由演講⼈負最終責任。

(mesoporous materials) ，化學感測 (chemical sensing) ，⾃組裝 (self assembly) ，同相催化
(homogeneous catalysis), heterogeneous catalysis, organometallic chemistry,
bioinorganic chemistry,...... 等有關無機化學的主題。
投影片：以清晰、簡潔為最低要求，圖形、文字的字體⼤⼩需適中，加彩⾊圖片、特效可加分。投影
片

11220CHEM598000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：化學⽣物⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chemical Biology Ⅱ
任課教師  Instructor ：林俊成
王聖凱
上課時間  Time ： M2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：化  125 ／ 73
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is designed for students understand the contemporary chemical
strategies to study biological issues. The course covers the introduction to
protein functions, signal transduction and glycoscience with emphasis on chemical
approaches to understand and solve biological problems.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Introduction to Bioorganic Chemistry and Chemical Biology
by D.A. Vranken and G. Weiss
三、參考書籍 (References)
Essentials of Glycobiology 2nd Ed
by A. Varki, R.D. Cummings, J.D. Esko, H.H. Freeze, P. Stanley, C.R. Bertozzi,
G.W. Hart and M.E. Etzler
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint lectures
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Part I: Chemical biology of protein function and signal transduction
Part II: Chemical approached in glycobiology
Part III: Synthesis of oligosaccharides
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
One oral presentation and two paper tests

eeClass

科號  Course Number ：
11220CHEM624000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：有機合成⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Synthesis (II)
任課教師  Instructor ：黃郁文
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F2 上課教室  Room ：化  121 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Textbook:
Advanced Organic Chemistry Part B, fifth Edition, by Carey and Sunderg
Reference book: Organic Synthesis, 2nd Ed.; by Michael B. Smith
Teaching Method:
The course will be delivered in English.
1. Carbon-Carbon Bond-Forming Reactions of Compounds of Boron, Silicon, and Tin (Chapter 9)
2. Organometallic Compounds (Chapters 7 and 8)
3. Pericyclic Reactions-electrocyclizations (continuation from organic synthesis I)
4. Aromatic Substitution Reactions (Chapter 8 and 11)
5. Reactions Invovling Carbocations, Carbenes, and Radicals as Reactive Intermediates (Chapter 10)
6. Multistep Syntheses (Chapter 13)
Two three-hour exams for mid-term (time TBA).
final exam will be a team challenge! each designated team will proposed a retro as well as a forward synthetic
route for a natural product and eventually present in front of the whole class.
Evaluation: 30% for each mid-term exams and 40% for the final exam; extra 10% bonus for in class
attendance.
**Not applicable to AI**

⼀、課程說明
本課程開設⽬的是確保⼤學部學⽣具備「學院知識表述能⼒」。教師透過選文的精讀指導，帶引學⽣
體察語⾔形式與表達內容的關係；透過寫作指導，從「問題意識的形成」到「資料的蒐集運⽤」到
「知識論述」再到「完成報告」。本課程教導學⽣如何遵循學院寫作模式，如何尊重他⼈智慧財產
權，確保學⽣充分知悉相關的學院規範。禁⽌使⽤  AI 。
⼆、指定教材
1. 劉承慧、王萬儀（主編），《⼤學中文教程 —— 學院報告寫作》，清華⼤學出版社。
2. 各班授課教師指定之精讀文本。
三、參考書籍
1. 清華⼤學寫作中⼼（編著），《⼤學中文寫作》，清華⼤學出版社。
2. 競寫歷屆題⽬與得獎作品（請於寫作中⼼網⾴最新消息之「競寫資訊」查詢）。
四、教學⽅式
由教師講解閱讀與寫作知識，並主導課堂討論。
五、教學進度
第⼀階段：學習、辨識四種基本寫作類型。
第⼆階段：收集並閱讀資料、建立問題意識、篩選資料、確定報告⽅向，初擬報告⼤綱。
第三階段：練習資料改寫、強化⽰例與推論、撰寫初稿、製作簡報（建議第 12 到 14 週之間進⾏）。
第四階段：確認無抄襲、確認文獻註記、調整組織架構、完成初稿。
第五階段：調整組織架構、檢查格式與註記、修訂文稿、完成報告。
六、成績考核
課堂表現 30% 、學期報告 70% 。
附註：
1. 學期報告包含完成學期報告所指定的階段性作業。
2. 學期報告的評分原則請參考「評分標準表」。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
　　本課程講授學院報告寫作的基本⽅法與規範，並引導學⽣從文本閱讀開始，逐步完成學院報告。
因
此，設定以下五點學習⽬標：⼀、了解學院報告基本架構　⼆、產⽣問題意識　三、了解學院報告格
式　四、避免學術抄襲　五、學習使⽤資料庫。
　　上課主要是老師講授每週的指定閱讀資料，並適時由學⽣發⾔。本課程共⼗六週，將擇數次進⾏
⼀
對⼀報告討論。
　　為掌握學⽣報告寫作進度，每次上課皆點名（佔分 20% ，含課堂參與，曠課超過三次本課程「不
及
格」），安排有數次作業與討論（佔分 30% ），並於期末繳交個⼈報告（佔分 50% ）。
　　本課程整體架構參考劉承慧、王萬儀主編《⼤學中文教程：學院報告寫作》，選修本課程的學
⽣，
可先⾏翻閱此著了解本課程⼤致的內容。另外，亦提供每週指定閱讀資料。
　　本課程為寫作課程，因此不⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作，但考量課程進度安排，也不反對學⽣利⽤
AI
使報告更加完善。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼤學中文課程⼤綱
⼀、課程說明
本課程開設⽬的是確保⼤學部學⽣具備「學院知識表述能⼒」。教師透過選文的精讀指導，帶
引學⽣體察語⾔形式與表達內容的關係；透過寫作指導，從「問題意識的形成」到「資料的蒐集運
⽤」到「知識論述」再到「完成報告」。本課程教導學⽣如何遵循學院寫作模式，如何尊重他⼈智慧
財產權，確保學⽣充分知悉相關的學院規範。
⼆、參考教材
1.劉承慧、王萬儀（主編），《⼤學中文教程 —— 學院報告寫作》（新⽵：清華⼤學， 2010 ）。
三、參考書籍
1.⾥慕伊．阿紀《⼭櫻花的故鄉》（台北：麥⽥， 2010 ）。
2.夏曼．藍波安，《老海⼈》（新北：印刻文學， 2009 ）。
3.拓拔斯．塔瑪匹瑪，《蘭嶼⾏醫記》（台中：晨星， 1998 ）。
4.亞榮隆．撒可努，《⼭豬．⾶鼠．撒可努》（新北市：耶魯， 2011 ）。
5.⽡歷斯．諾幹，《戴墨鏡的⾶鼠》（台中：晨星， 2017 ）。
6.劉克襄，《風⿃⽪諾查》（台北：遠流， 2007 ）。
7.吳明益，《家離⽔邊那麼近》（台北：⼆⿂文化， 2007 ）。
8.廖鴻基，《鯨⽣鯨世》（台中：晨星， 2012 ）。
四、教學⽅式
1.教學⽅式為文本閱讀、講解、提問與討論、活動、⼝頭報告、書⾯報告。
2.本課程注重課堂討論與發⾔，上課前必須先閱讀指定文本與相關材料。
五、教學進度
【第 1週： 02/21 】課程簡介：學院報告寫作
1.王秋今，〈創新⼤學中文：完成⼀篇學院報告的教學實踐〉，《⼤學教學實務與研究學刊》 6 卷 1
期（ 2022 年 06 ⽉），⾴ 41-76 。
2.劉承慧、王萬儀（主編），《⼤學中文教程 —— 學院報告寫作》（新⽵：清華⼤學， 2010 ）。
【第 2週： 02/28 】和平紀念⽇
【第 3週： 03/6 】問題意識
文本：⾥慕伊．阿紀《⼭櫻花的故鄉》（台北：麥⽥， 2010 ）。
作業 1：尋找問題意識。
參考閱讀：
1.王秋今，〈⽣態智慧：⾥慕伊．阿紀《⼭櫻花的故鄉》的三維⽣態學〉，《台灣原住⺠族研究》
第15卷第 1 期（ 2022 年 6 ⽉），⾴ 307-337 。
2.⾥慕伊．阿紀，《⼭野笛聲》（台中：晨星， 2001 ）。
【第 4週： 03/13 】題⽬與⼤綱
文本：夏曼．藍波安，《老海⼈》（新北：印刻文學， 2009 ）。
作業 2：試擬題⽬與⼤綱。
參考閱讀：

（2012.06 ），⾴ 231+233-249 。
2.夏曼．藍波安，《天空的眼睛》（台北：聯經， 2012 ）。
【第 5週： 03/20 】前⾔與內文標題
文本：拓拔斯．塔瑪匹瑪，《蘭嶼⾏醫記》（台中：晨星， 1998 ）。

參考閱讀：

12⽉），⾴ 151~167 。
2.拓拔斯．塔瑪匹瑪，《最後的獵⼈》（台中：晨星， 2012 ）。

文本：亞榮隆．撒可努，《⼭豬．⾶鼠．撒可努》（新北市：耶魯， 2011 ）。
作業 4：書寫⾃⼰的主張。
參考閱讀：
1.謝世忠，〈「⺠族⽣態⼈」知識體系的建構 —— 評亞榮隆．撒可努著《⾛風的⼈：我的獵⼈⽗
親》〉，《原住⺠教育季刊》 30 （ 2003. 05 ），⾴ 136 -141 。
2.亞榮隆．撒可努，《⾛風的⼈：我的獵⼈⽗親》（新北市：耶魯， 2011 ）。
【第 7週： 04/3 】校際活動週停課
【第 8週： 04/10 】文本分析

《台灣原住⺠研究論叢》 3 （ 2008.06 ），⾴ 31-63 。
2.⽡歷斯．諾幹，《迷霧之旅》（台中：晨星， 2003 ）。
【第 9週： 04/17 】期中報告（題⽬、前⾔、⼤綱、內文標題）（⼀）
【第 10週： 04/24 】期中報告（題⽬、前⾔、⼤綱、內文標題）（⼆）
【第 11週： 05/01 】改寫
文本：劉克襄，《風⿃⽪諾查》（台北：遠流， 2007 ）。

1.黃宗潔，〈劉克襄動物⼩說中的⾃然觀〉，《東華漢學》 10 期（ 2009.12 ），⾴ 285-324 。
2.劉克襄，《永遠的信天翁》（台北：遠流， 2008 ）。
【第 12週： 05/08 】引述 ⁄ 拼貼與抄襲
文本：吳明益，《家離⽔邊那麼近》（台北：⼆⿂文化， 2007 ）。
參考閱讀：
1.莊傳芬，〈全球⽣態意識的在地展現：吳明益《家離⽔那麼近》中的⽔域⽣態與族群文化景
觀〉，《台灣文學研究》 4 期（ 2013.06 ），⾴ 231+233-259 。
2.吳明益，《複眼⼈》（台北：夏⽇， 2011 ）。
【第 13週： 05/15 】報告格式與文獻註記
文本：廖鴻基，《鯨⽣鯨世》（台中：晨星， 2012 ）。
參考閱讀：
1.王國安，〈論夏曼．藍波安與廖鴻基海洋書寫的差異〉，《⼈文社會科學研究》 6 卷 4 期
（2012.12 ），⾴ 26-45 。
2.廖鴻基，《討海⼈》（台中：晨星， 2013 ）。
【第 14週： 05/22 】期末報告（內文、格式）（⼀）
【第 15週： 05/29 】期末報告（內文、格式）（⼆）
【第 16週： 06/05 】期末考週  期末報告繳交期限 06/12
六、成績考核：
1. 隨堂作業： 20% （共四次隨堂作業， 04/24 ⽇前繳交）。
2. 課堂報告： 20% （共兩次課堂報告，每次報告時間 5-8 分鐘）。
3. 課堂參與： 20% （出席、發⾔、討論）。
4. 期末報告： 40% （繳交完整期末報告，字數約 2500-5000 字，請於 06/12 ⽇ 17 ： 00 前上傳，並繳
交紙本⾄教師信箱。）
注意事項：
經仔細考量後，本課程授課教師認為不宜於此⾨課程當中使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧於課堂學習當
中。因本課程的內容於⽣成式 AI 中尚有諸多錯誤，且容易影響學⽣對基礎核⼼知識之判讀。根據本
校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取禁⽌使⽤，以下為相
關的監管機制：
修讀本⾨課程之學⽣應注意本⾨課不得繳交使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧所產出的作業、報告或個⼈⼼
得。若經查核發現，教師、學校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
禁⽌使⽤參考範例：
經仔細考量後，本課程授課教師認為不宜於此⾨課程當中使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧於課堂學習當中。因本
課程的內容於
⽣成式 AI 中尚有諸多錯誤，且容易影響學⽣對基礎核⼼知識之判讀。
根據本校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取禁⽌使⽤，以下
為相關的監管
機制
修讀本⾨課程之學⽣應注意本⾨課不得繳交使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧所產出的作業、報告或個⼈⼼得。若
經查核發現，
教師、學校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。
科號  Course Number ： 11220CL
102022學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
25
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼤學中文
英文名稱  Course English Title ： College Chinese
任課教師  Instructor ：余能城
上課時間  Time ： R5R6 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  421 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
　　本課程講授學院報告寫作的基本⽅法與規範，並引導學⽣從文本閱讀開始，逐步完成學院報告。
因
此，設定以下五點學習⽬標：⼀、了解學院報告基本架構　⼆、產⽣問題意識　三、了解學院報告格
式　四、避免學術抄襲　五、學習使⽤資料庫。
　　上課主要是老師講授每週的指定閱讀資料，並適時由學⽣發⾔。本課程共⼗六週，將擇數次進⾏
⼀
對⼀報告討論。
　　為掌握學⽣報告寫作進度，每次上課皆點名（佔分 20% ，含課堂參與，曠課超過三次本課程「不
及
格」），安排有數次作業與討論（佔分 30% ），並於期末繳交個⼈報告（佔分 50% ）。
　　本課程整體架構參考劉承慧、王萬儀主編《⼤學中文教程：學院報告寫作》，選修本課程的學
⽣，
可先⾏翻閱此著了解本課程⼤致的內容。另外，亦提供每週指定閱讀資料。
　　本課程為寫作課程，因此不⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作，但考量課程進度安排，也不反對學⽣利⽤
AI
使報告更加完善。
科號  Course Number ： 11220CL
102023學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
25
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼤學中文
英文名稱  Course English Title ： College Chinese
任課教師  Instructor ：王秋今
上課時間  Time ： R5R6 上課教室  Room ：綜三  115 ／ 35
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼤學中文課程⼤綱
⼀、課程說明
本課程開設⽬的是確保⼤學部學⽣具備「學院知識表述能⼒」。教師透過選文的精讀指導，帶
引學⽣體察語⾔形式與表達內容的關係；透過寫作指導，從「問題意識的形成」到「資料的蒐集運
⽤」到「知識論述」再到「完成報告」。本課程教導學⽣如何遵循學院寫作模式，如何尊重他⼈智慧
財產權，確保學⽣充分知悉相關的學院規範。
⼆、參考教材
1.劉承慧、王萬儀（主編），《⼤學中文教程 —— 學院報告寫作》（新⽵：清華⼤學， 2010 ）。
三、參考書籍
1.⾥慕伊．阿紀《⼭櫻花的故鄉》（台北：麥⽥， 2010 ）。
2.夏曼．藍波安，《老海⼈》（新北：印刻文學， 2009 ）。
3.拓拔斯．塔瑪匹瑪，《蘭嶼⾏醫記》（台中：晨星， 1998 ）。
4.亞榮隆．撒可努，《⼭豬．⾶鼠．撒可努》（新北市：耶魯， 2011 ）。
5.⽡歷斯．諾幹，《戴墨鏡的⾶鼠》（台中：晨星， 2017 ）。
6.劉克襄，《風⿃⽪諾查》（台北：遠流， 2007 ）。
7.吳明益，《家離⽔邊那麼近》（台北：⼆⿂文化， 2007 ）。
8.廖鴻基，《鯨⽣鯨世》（台中：晨星， 2012 ）。
四、教學⽅式
1.教學⽅式為文本閱讀、講解、提問與討論、活動、⼝頭報告、書⾯報告。
2.本課程注重課堂討論與發⾔，上課前必須先閱讀指定文本與相關材料。
五、教學進度
【第 1週： 02/22 】課程簡介：學院報告寫作
參考閱讀：
1.王秋今，〈創新⼤學中文：完成⼀篇學院報告的教學實踐〉，《⼤學教學實務與研究學刊》 6 卷 1
期（ 2022 年 06 ⽉），⾴ 41-76 。
2.劉承慧、王萬儀（主編），《⼤學中文教程 —— 學院報告寫作》（新⽵：清華⼤學， 2010 ）。
【第 2週： 02/29 】問題意識
文本：⾥慕伊．阿紀《⼭櫻花的故鄉》（台北：麥⽥， 2010 ）。
作業 1：尋找問題意識。
參考閱讀：
1.王秋今，〈⽣態智慧：⾥慕伊．阿紀《⼭櫻花的故鄉》的三維⽣態學〉，《台灣原住⺠族研究》
第15卷第 1 期（ 2022 年 6 ⽉），⾴ 307-337 。
2.⾥慕伊．阿紀，《⼭野笛聲》（台中：晨星， 2001 ）。
【第 3週： 03/7 】題⽬與⼤綱
文本：夏曼．藍波安，《老海⼈》（新北：印刻文學， 2009 ）。
作業 2：試擬題⽬與⼤綱。
參考閱讀：
1.李育霖，〈游牧的時間：夏曼．藍波安關於海浪的記憶〉，《台灣文學研究》 2 期
（2012.06 ），⾴ 231+233-249 。
2.夏曼．藍波安，《天空的眼睛》（台北：聯經， 2012 ）。
【第 4週： 03/14 】前⾔與內文標題
文本：拓拔斯．塔瑪匹瑪，《蘭嶼⾏醫記》（台中：晨星， 1998 ）。
作業 3：書寫前⾔與內文標題。
參考閱讀：
1.王秋今，〈越界與轉譯：⽥雅各《蘭嶼⾏醫記》的跨文化醫療〉，《臺灣研究》第 21 期（ 2022 年
12⽉），⾴ 151~167 。
2.拓拔斯．塔瑪匹瑪，《最後的獵⼈》（台中：晨星， 2012 ）。
【第 5週： 03/21 】主張－⽀撐－推論
文本：亞榮隆．撒可努，《⼭豬．⾶鼠．撒可努》（新北市：耶魯， 2011 ）。
作業 4：書寫⾃⼰的主張。
參考閱讀：
1.謝世忠，〈「⺠族⽣態⼈」知識體系的建構 —— 評亞榮隆．撒可努著《⾛風的⼈：我的獵⼈⽗
親》〉，《原住⺠教育季刊》 30 （ 2003. 05 ），⾴ 136 -141 。
2.亞榮隆．撒可努，《⾛風的⼈：我的獵⼈⽗親》（新北市：耶魯， 2011 ）。
【第 6週： 03/28 】文本分析
文本：⽡歷斯．諾幹，《戴墨鏡的⾶鼠》（台中：晨星， 2017 ）。
參考閱讀：
1.巴蘇亞．博伊哲努（浦忠成），〈出入創作與論述之間的原住⺠文學健筆：⽡歷斯．諾幹〉，
《台灣原住⺠研究論叢》 3 （ 2008.06 ），⾴ 31-63 。
2.⽡歷斯．諾幹，《迷霧之旅》（台中：晨星， 2003 ）。
【第 7週： 04/04 】⺠族掃墓節 ⁄ 兒童節
【第 8週： 04/11 】期中報告（題⽬、前⾔、⼤綱、內文標題）（⼀）
【第 9週： 04/18 】期中報告（題⽬、前⾔、⼤綱、內文標題）（⼆）
【第 10週： 04/25 】期中報告（題⽬、前⾔、⼤綱、內文標題）（三）
【第 11週： 05/02 】改寫
文本：劉克襄，《風⿃⽪諾查》（台北：遠流， 2007 ）。
參考閱讀：
1.黃宗潔，〈劉克襄動物⼩說中的⾃然觀〉，《東華漢學》 10 期（ 2009.12 ），⾴ 285-324 。
2.劉克襄，《永遠的信天翁》（台北：遠流， 2008 ）。
【第 12週： 05/09 】引述 ⁄ 拼貼與抄襲
文本：吳明益，《家離⽔邊那麼近》（台北：⼆⿂文化， 2007 ）。
參考閱讀：
1.莊傳芬，〈全球⽣態意識的在地展現：吳明益《家離⽔那麼近》中的⽔域⽣態與族群文化景
觀〉，《台灣文學研究》 4 期（ 2013.06 ），⾴ 231+233-259 。
2.吳明益，《複眼⼈》（台北：夏⽇， 2011 ）。
【第 13週： 05/16 】報告格式與文獻註記
文本：廖鴻基，《鯨⽣鯨世》（台中：晨星， 2012 ）。
參考閱讀：
1.王國安，〈論夏曼．藍波安與廖鴻基海洋書寫的差異〉，《⼈文社會科學研究》 6 卷 4 期
（2012.12 ），⾴ 26-45 。
2.廖鴻基，《討海⼈》（台中：晨星， 2013 ）。
【第 14週： 05/23 】期末報告（內文、格式）（⼀）
【第 15週： 05/30 】期末報告（內文、格式）（⼆）
【第 16週： 06/06 】期末考週  期末報告繳交期限 06/13
六、成績考核：
1. 隨堂作業： 20% （共四次隨堂作業， 04/25 ⽇前繳交）。
2. 課堂報告： 20% （共兩次課堂報告，每次報告時間 5-8 分鐘）。
3. 課堂參與： 20% （出席、發⾔、討論）。
4. 期末報告： 40% （繳交完整期末報告，字數約 2500-5000 字，請於 06/13 ⽇ 17 ： 00 前上傳，並繳
交紙本⾄教師信箱。）
注意事項：
經仔細考量後，本課程授課教師認為不宜於此⾨課程當中使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧於課堂學習當
中。因本課程的內容於⽣成式 AI 中尚有諸多錯誤，且容易影響學⽣對基礎核⼼知識之判讀。根據本
校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取禁⽌使⽤，以下為相
關的監管機制：
修讀本⾨課程之學⽣應注意本⾨課不得繳交使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧所產出的作業、報告或個⼈⼼
得。若經查核發現，教師、學校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程透過有系統的古典詩教學，讓中文系本科⽣擁有古典詩的創作技巧及鑒賞能⼒。課程中對古典
詩之體式，包
括平仄、格律、⽤韻、章法，均作詳細說明，對絕句、律詩的創作法則亦分別作深入講解，並將詩篇
賞鑒融入其中；
上課中所教授之相關創作⽅法、理論，在名家詩作中可立即印證。學⽣在體會名作佳篇之情意內容、
獲取美感經驗的
同時，對歷代重要詩學觀念、古典詩的形式內涵、詩中語⾔、聲律、情景 …… 等元素的掌握和運⽤，
皆能有所會⼼。
修習本課程學⽣需進⾏古典詩（主要是近體七絕和七律）的習作，除透過教師個別指導外，學期中會
有若⼲課堂討
論，同學在⾃⼰的創作經驗和評賞過程中，可以充分掌握進入古典詩苑圃的⾦鑰。

科號  Course Number ： 11220CL
111003學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
17
中文名稱  Course Title ：基礎寫作
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Basic Writing
任課教師  Instructor ：羅漪文
上課時間  Time ： R3R4 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C403 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
◎課程說明（ Course Description）
語⾔文字是⼈際溝通的基礎、信念傳播與情感表達的媒介，其性質、結構、⽅法與效能，亦是文學
相關科系訓練的核⼼之⼀。「基礎寫作」課程⽤意並非訓練文學創作能⼒，⽽是希望能聚焦在切
題、造句、謀篇，訓練學⽣整合表達知識與意⾒的基礎文字能⼒。
經仔細考量後，本課程授課教師認為不宜於此⾨課程當中使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧於課堂學習當中。因
本課程的內容於⽣成式 AI 中尚有諸多錯誤，且容易影響學⽣對基礎核⼼知識之判讀。
根據本校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取禁⽌使⽤，以
下為相關的監管機制：
修讀本⾨課程之學⽣應注意本⾨課不得繳交使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧所產出的作業、報告或個⼈⼼得。
若經查核發現，教師、學校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。
◎教學⽅式（ Teaching Method ）
1. 由教師解說寫作之基本理念與⽅法，並分析能展⽰相關寫作⽅法與成效的範文，再請學⽣
以作業演練所學。
2. 教師將仔細批改學⽣作業，指出可修訂之處，以利學⽣精進寫作技巧。在多次作業演練與
批改下，教師也更能掌握學⽣程度與進境，給予切實建議。
◎教學進度 (Syllabus)
週次  ⽇期  主題  作業

成績考核（ Evaluation ）
1. 七次⼩作業，共佔 70% 。依據各次要求寫作，⼀律在隔週週⼀午夜前上傳教學網站。
2. ⼤作業提案 + 成果，共佔 30% 。提案以 500 字為限，成果字數請把握在 4000 字（ ±100 ），並
請最晚在第⼗八週的周四（ 6/20 ）當天中午前上傳。
3. 出席情況將作為學期總分數增減之參考。
4. 願意針對⼩作業⼀到六所獲之教師建議進⾏修訂者，最晚於第⼗五週週四午夜之前統整上
傳，若修訂可⾒明顯進步者，予以加分。（此項非強制）
