中文名稱  Course Title ：數位科技與法律
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Digital Technology and Law
任課教師  Instructor ：彭⼼儀
上課時間  Time ： TbTc 上課教室  Room ：深圳研究／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程⽬標：
法律制度正⾯臨科學技術、經濟、社會及地緣政治各錯綜因素所導致的巨變。⼤數據、物聯網與⼈
⼯智慧時代的來臨，挑戰傳統商務秩序。
本課程之⽬標在於有系統地說明數位科技時代所應具備之法律知識。新科技帶來新的社會⽣活⽅
式、產⽣新的經濟模式與新的產業樣貌，課程將透過各單元，聚焦檢視數位科技主要法律議題。
教學⽅式：
每單元分發參考文獻，內容涵蓋實務案例、產業資訊及法律文件等。
針對主題提供討論⼤綱，引導思辨，依據相關法律及案例，探究法律與科技的互動。
教學進度：
⼤數據、隱私與個資保護
數位貿易與資料流動
物聯網與資料安全
共享經濟時代的商業模式及管制爭議
線上影⾳視頻法律問題
分組討論與報告
⼈⼯智能法律風險與責任
智慧⼯廠、智慧製造與法律
5G資通訊基礎建設與社會發展
數位落差、數位包容
分組討論與報告
評分標準：
個⼈課堂出席及發⾔參與： 50%
分組課堂報告（⼆次）：  50%

科號  Course Number ： 11220EMS
500900學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：創新與創業
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Innovation and Entrepreneurship
任課教師  Instructor ：張元杰
上課時間  Time ： S9Sa 上課教室  Room ：深圳研究／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
National Tsing Hua University
College of Technology Management ／ EMBA
Course Syllabus: Innovation and Entrepreneurship ( 創新與創業 )
授課教師／ Instructors
張元杰  Dr. Yuan-Chieh Chang (yucchang@mx.nthu.edu.tw)
胡美智  Dr. Mei-Chih Hu (mchu@mx.nthu.edu.tw)
課程助教／ Class TA:
TBA
A. 課程介紹／ Course Description:
1.介紹創業管理的基礎知識與技能，使學⽣能瞭解創業精神與經濟發展、企業管理之間的關係
及
實務創業家所關⼼主要問題。
2.開拓學⽣的視野，瞭解專業經理⼈除了要為股東善盡效率管理⼈之責任外，發揮創業精神才
是
創造企業成⻑及獲得超額利潤的來源。有助於培養 MBA 學⽣以創新思維，處理既有企業的新事業
發展管理、創投事業經營與⾃⾏創業的能⼒。
3.使學⽣瞭解新創事業的特性與其所⾯臨的相關管理問題，如分析創業商機、撰寫創業計畫
書、
籌募資⾦、管理成⻑與經營團隊管理。
The objective of this course is to provide the student with an
understanding of the problems and challenges facing an entrepreneur in the
process of creating a business. The course will use the development of a
business plan as the focal point. Groups of students will develop a business
plan piece by piece. Each group will make 2 case presentations and write a
business plan during the semester.
Therefore the focus of this course is the planning and development of new
ventures for the growth and profits of new or existing enterprises. The
students will gain a firm understanding and the competence in the area of
entrepreneurship. The business plan projects are required, which will
further elaborate on particular aspects of the course according to the
student’s own objectives and background. The business plan projects also
help to consolidate theories and best practices from the western countries
to the context of Taiwan’s industries. Interactive learning is emphasized
throughout the course. Student’s participation in class, including
discussion, homework, and project presentation is a critical and integral
part of the course.
B. Textbooks:
Timmons, J.A. and Spinelli, S. (2018) New Venture Creation: Entrepreneurship
for the 21st Century, 9th Ed., McGraw-Hill. ( 華泰代理 )
C. References:
1.Compers, P. and Lerner, J. (1999) The Venture Capital Cycle, MA: The MIT
Press.
2.Dollinger, M. J. (1999) Entrepreneurship: Strategies and Resources, NJ:
Prentice-Hall.
3.Holt, D. H. (1992) Entrepreneurship: New Venture Creation, NJ: Prentice-
Hall.
4.Kao, John (1989) Entrepreneurship, Creativity, and Organization: Text,
Cases, and Readings, International Edition, NJ: Prentice-Hall.
5.劉世平  譯  (1999) 企業家精神，商業周刊出版社。
D. Evaluation:
1.Participation 30%
2.Homework 30%
3.Final report 40%
E. Teaching Approach:
1.Lecture 50%
2.Case Study 30%
3.Presentation 20%
Q95;
F. Course Schedule:
1.創新管理思潮與開放式創新

科號  Course Number ： 11220EMS
501700學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：服務科學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Service Science
任課教師  Instructor ：王俊程
上課時間  Time ： SbSc 上課教室  Room ：深圳研究／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
國立清華⼤學科技管理學院
MBA558901
服務科學
(Introduction to Service Science)
課程⼤綱
授課教師：王俊程教授
課程簡介：
眾所週知，世界已經邁向了服務經濟的時代。「服務」存在⼈類社會遠在所謂的「服務業」的產業
分類。但究竟
「服務」是什麼？⽽當 IBM 於 2004 年倡導所謂的「服務科學」，或者後來加上⼯程與管理，統稱「服
務科學⼯程
與管理」 (Service Science, Management, and Engineering, SSME) 。近年來，在原有的 SSME
外加
上Design ，成為現在⼀般談及服務科學時，以 SSMED 來描述它。究竟其內涵與實質內容為何？究竟
服務科學的
範圍與議題為何？服務科學與現有的學術與實務領域有何關聯？如何將服務科學的理論應⽤於實務
上？實務上的
議題與需求如何來成為服務科學的研究內容與貢獻？本課程的課程內容規劃即在滿⾜⼤家對服務科
學的好奇⼼。
同時也希望學⽣能勇敢地探索此⼀新的領域，成為服務科學發展學術與實務社群的⽣⼒軍。
本課程的⽬標簡述如下：
1. 學⽣能完整定義服務科學的內涵與範疇。
2. 學⽣能應⽤服務體驗設計，進⾏服務設計。
3. 學⽣能分析與規劃服務價值網絡以提供服務價值。
4. 學⽣能針對不同的產業提出創新的服務模式。
5. 學⽣能指出重要的服務科學相關的重要議題，進⾏研究。
本課程的內容與教學具有以下的特⾊：
1. 理論與實務並重；
2. 講授與個案教學相輔相成；
3. 實作專案，內化知識與能⼒。
課程模組與主題：
⼀、服務科學簡介
1. What is service science?
2. Service science, the revolution vs. the evolution?
3. Service economy, where does the service value come from?
4. Service innovation, what can be counted as service innovation?
⼆、服務體驗設計
1. How do you know potential customers’ needs?
2. Methods for service design and engineering
3. New service development (NSD)
4. New service development project management.
三、服務價值網絡
1. How to articulate segmented business processes as a value added service
network?
2. How to add service value to products?
四、資訊科技與服務科學
1. IT service
2. Service-oriented Architecture (SOA)
3. Cloud computing and service
四、服務科學與服務開放創新
1. Service open innovation
2. Service experimentation
3. Service quality
4. Service globalization
評分要點：課程參與： 60% 作業： 40%

科號  Course Number ： 11220ENE
512500學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
30
中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體物理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Semiconductor Physics
任課教師  Instructor ：吳⽟書
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：台達 202 ／ 32
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course focuses on the basic physics of semiconductors, in particular
the various quantum processes that are important for device applications.
The highlights are band structures, electron-
impurity scattering, optical transitions, and electron transport theory.
The students are required to have backgrounds in quantum mechanics and
solid state physics both at the introductory level.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
my own lecture notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
"Semiconductor physics and applications", by Balkanski and Wallis
"Principles of the theory of solids", by J. M. Ziman
"Quantum processes in semiconductors", by B. K. Ridley
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Mainly by class lectures.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Theory of band structures
i) Bloch's theorem: a revisit
ii) tight-binding method
ii) k.p method (with review of time-independent perturbation theory)
2. Effective mass theory
i) Effective mass theorem
ii)applications:
external field
impurity states in semiconductors
excitons
3. Semi-classical theory of carrier transport
i) phenomenological description of carrier scattering
ii) DC / AC electrical conductivity
iii) carrier transport in magnetic field
4. optical properties of solids
i) review of time-dependent perturbation theory / Fermi's
golden rule
ii) light-matter interaction (with review of Maxwell equations,
vector potential concept)
iii) quantum mechanical derivation of optical absorption
iv) quantum well photodetectors
v) complex dielectric function
vi) simple harmonic oscillator model of dielectric function
vii) Kramers-Kronig relation
5. carrier scattering
i) neutral impurity scattering
ii) ionized impurity scattering
iii) electron-phonon scattering
6. elelctron transport theory
i) Boltzmann transport equation
ii) relaxation time approximation
iii) analytic solution in the linear transport regime
iv) device equations
v) high field transport
vi) hot electron phenomena: velocity saturation
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
homework, midterm and final tests
Note: This course is free of any AI-related issues.
七、可連結之網⾴位址

w14: Midterm quiz (T7T8)

525000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：

中文名稱  Course Title ：微波電路分析及設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Analysis and Design of Microwave Circuits
任課教師  Instructor ：徐碩鴻  Hsu Shuo Hung
上課時間  Time ： M5M6W5 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Welcome to the world of microwave circuits. This area impacts many recent
electronic developments such as wireless communication and high-speed
optoelectronic systems. This course introduces concepts and principles of
circuit analysis and design at microwave frequencies by examining both
active and passive devices. Microwave device modeling and non-ideal effects
in circuit operation such as noise and nonlinear distortion are also
emphasized. The design techniques required to develop most of the major
building blocks in modern microwave systems are also included.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
G. Gonzalez, “Microwave Transistor Amplifiers: Analysis & Design,” Prentice
Hall, 1996.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. G. D. Vendelin, "Microwave circuit design using linear and nonlinear
techniques", Wiley-interscience, 1990
2. I. Bahl and P. Bhartia, "Microwave solid state circuit design", 2nd edition,
Wiley-interscience, 2003
3. T. Lee, "The Design of CMOS radio-frequency integrated circuits", 2nd
edition, Cambridge, 2004.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Power point handouts are used in this class and the notes are written on the
computer directly using a tablet laptop computer. CAD tool (Advanced Design
System) is intensively used in this class to let the students have opportunities
using industrial standard approaches for microwave circuit design.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
- Introduction
- Two-port networks
- Transmission line
- S-parameters
- Power waves and power gain
- Matching network
- Microwave transistor amplifier design
- Bias networks
- Device characteristics and modeling
- Low noise amplifier
- Broadband amplifier
- Power amplifier
- Microwave oscillator
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
- Homework (20%)

- Midterm (20%)
- Final exam (20%)
- Final project (30%)

This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive view of modern
semiconductor devices for power electronic applications. After completing this
course, the students will be able to understand the operating physics and
electrical characteristics of power devices, as well as their design
considerations.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀,課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive view of semiconductor
material and device charaterization techniques. After completing this course, the
students will be able to understand
the physics, the principles, and measurement methods for basic semiconductor
device characterizations.
⼆,指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. Dieter K Schroder, Semiconductor material and device characterization, Wiley
InterScience (Online service), 2006.
三,參考書籍 (References)
None.
四,教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture in Chinese.
五,教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Resistivity(two weeks)
2. Carrier and Doping Density(two weeks)
3. Contact Resistance and Schottky Barriers(two weeks)
4. Series Resistance, Channel Length and Width, and Threshold Voltage(two weeks)
5. Defects(two weeks)
6. Oxide and Interface Trapped Charges, Oxide Thickness(two weeks)
7. Carrier Lifetimes(two weeks)
8. Mobility(two weeks)
六,成績考核 (Evaluation)
To be determined
七,講義位址 (http://)
elearn.nthu.edu.tw
八,本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤  Not applicable

中文名稱  Course Title ：邏輯非揮發性記憶體
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Logic Non-Volatile Memory
任課教師  Instructor ：⾦雅琴  Ya-Chin King
上課時間  Time ： W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：台達 217 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will examine in detail the modern Logic non-volalitile memory
including device structure, process, reliability, design, characterization,
qualification, application and IP.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
"Logic Non-Volatile Memory" by Charles Ching-Hsiang Hsu , World Scientific 2014.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Logic non-volalitile memory.
2. Review of Semiconductor Physics.
3. Review of Semiconductor Device Physics.
4. OTP Cell, Process Integration and Reliability.
5. OTP Design.
6. OTP ESD and Applications.
7. FLASH Devices and Process Integration.
8. FLASH P Reliability.
9. FLASH Design.
10. EEPROM Devices and Process Integration.
11. EEPROM Design.
12. OTP/FLASH/EEPROM Testing, Characterization and Qualification.
13. NVM IP Foundry.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. 六次作業或⼩考  ( 25% )
2. ⼆次期中考  ( 25%/ 次  )
3. 期末專題研究  (Term Project) ( 25% )

中文名稱  Course Title ：氮化鎵功率與射頻元件技術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Gallium Nitride based Power and RF Technology
任課教師  Instructor ：黃敬源
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：台達 211 ／ 51
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
An introduction of the compound semiconductor power and RF device technology
includes device, epitaxy, process, package, circuit topology, stability &
reliability, modeling and integration circuits.
Course objective:
To enable students to establish an overview understanding on various technical
aspects of compound semiconductor power and RF device technology.
Course Outcomes:
1. Upon of completion of this course, the participants should be able to:
2. Understanding the evolution of compound semiconductor power and RF device
technology development.
3. Understanding the advantages and challenges of compound semiconductor power
and RF device technology.
4. Understanding the technical breakthroughs and future directions of device,
epitaxial, process
and packaging design.
5. Understanding the basic stability and reliability of compound semiconductor
power and RF device technology.
6. Understanding future development directions in ICs and applications.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Gaudenzio Meneghesso, Matteo Meneghini, Enrico Zanoni, “Gallium Nitride-enabled
High Frequency and High Efficiency Power Conversion”, 2018, Springer.
● 參考書籍 (References)
B. Baliga, “Fundamentals of Power Semiconductor Devices”, 2008, Springer.
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures offered in English
教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Wide bandgap Semiconductor Power Devices
2. Introduction to GaN-on-Si Power HEMTs (Device Physics)
3. GaN-on-Si Epitaxy Technology for GaN Power HEMTs
4. CMOS-compatible Process for GaN Power HEMT Fabrication
5. GaN Power Device Stability and Reliability
6. Circuit Topologies for GaN Power HEMT Applications
7. Packaging of GaN Power HEMTs
8. Modeling of GaN power HEMTs
9. Monolithic Integration and Co-package Solutions
10. Introduction of Compound semiconductor RF Devices
Final Project
-GaN HEMT Device Fabrication
-GaN HEMT Characterization
-Board-level Characterization
-Presentation
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Course Quiz: 70%
Final project: 30%

中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程與系統科學探索
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Exploring ESS
任課教師  Instructor ：蘇育全
陳燦耀
吳順吉
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  501 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程背景與⽬標
本課程採⽤「共時授課形式」，邀請系上不同領域教授共同參與，讓⼤⼀新⽣可深入了解⼯科系的多
種
⾯向。參與本課程的學⽣除有機會和系上各領域教授及其實驗室有近距離接觸，也能參觀國內幾個和
本
系密切合作的國家級研究機構。
本課程包含三⼤主題：
（⼀）⼯科系介紹及探索：介紹本系的研究領域及相關議題。各研究領域在全球及台灣的現況與發
展、
並安排各實驗室輪習；
（⼆）新興科技特性與應⽤介紹：介紹近年來流⾏的新興科技的相關特性以及應⽤場域與介紹不同科
技
如何被研發或應⽤在場域中，題材包含 : ⽣物醫學感測，次世代材料、半導體分析技術，醫學物理治
療
技術等；
（三）創新設計發想：介紹設計思考步驟及分組別發想並評估，⿎勵所得發想可參與原科院創意競
賽。
修課⼈數上限： 30 ⼈
參考書⽬：
無。
評量⽅式
1. 實驗室輪習⼼得報告：包含⽉⼼得報告 (A4 ⼀⾴計 3 次 )+ 期末報告 (A4 四⾴會議論文格式，內容涵蓋
整學期輪習⼼得及未來的修課與研究規劃 ) 。（ 60% ）
2. 分組期中提案：提案內容需包含設計理念、初步構想和預期成果，⼝頭報告 10 分鐘，書⾯說明⾄多
A4兩⾴。（ 15% ）
3. 分組期末提案發表：設計成果⼝頭報告與具體執⾏書⾯規劃，成績評比除受課老師評比，也會有各
組內外互評。（ 25% ）
每2週上課⼀次（每次  2 hrs. ）
1. 課程說明與實驗室輪習規劃
2. 設計思考⼯作坊
3. 研究議題分享⼀  授課與系上教授
4. 研究機構參訪⼀
5. 期中提案報告
6. 簡報技巧⼯作坊
7. 研究議題分享⼆  授課與系上教授
8. 研究機構參訪⼆
9. 期末提案發表
*AI 使⽤規則：  有條件開放，請註明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 於課程產出。

中文名稱  Course Title ：能源與環境概論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Energy and Environment
任課教師  Instructor ：陳燦耀
上課時間  Time ： W3W4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 120 ／ 150
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
(暫定 )
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
本課程涵蓋不同能源型態的基本原理與應⽤⽅式，同時也將說明不同形式能源的可⽤量與經濟性，
及其對地球環境的影響。本課程區分下列主題：能源基礎概念、⽯化燃料、熱引擎、再⽣能源（太
陽能、氫能、風能、⽔⼒、⽣質能）、核能、節能與潔能、交通運輸之應⽤、空氣污染與溫室效
應。
⼆、教科書  (Text books)
Richard A. Dunlap (Dalhousie University), Sustainable Energy, SI Edition,
CENGAGE
Learning ( 歐亞書局 )
三、參考書籍  (Reference)
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
投影片
群組討論報告
⼾外教學與課堂討論
課程模組 : 網址  http://www.learnenergy.tw/index.php?inter=digital&caid=4
兩次於課堂中播放課程模組的影片，課堂拍照記錄。
遠端教學  ( 視疫情狀況調整 )
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Chapter 0. Overview on energy engineering and the corresponding impacts on
environment (week 1–2)
Chapter 1. Introduction to Energy Generation, Delivery, and Conversion (week
2–4)
course module 1: week 4
Chapter 2. Energy Sources (week 4 – 5)
Chapter 3. Fossil Fuels: Petroleum, Natural Gas and Coal(week 5–7)
Chapter 4. Environmental Impact of energy use and conversion (week 7–8)
course module 2: week 8
Chapter 5. out door experience and oral presentation on weekly findings (week
9–17)
六、成績考核  (Evaluation) confirmed
1. Mid-term Examination (open book): 50%
2. out door experience and oral presentation on weekly findings (group
discussion / presentation): 50%
3. in class raise hand question: 5%

225000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：

中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦學⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronics II
任課教師  Instructor ：盧志文
上課時間  Time ： FnF5F6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Having learned the major electronics devices (MOSFET and BJT) and their basic
circuit applications in Electronics-I, more complex analog circuits and systems
will be lectured in this course. Both MOSFET and BJT circuits will be studied and
the emphasis will be put on MOSFET since it is used in most integrated circuit.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Sedra/Smith, "Microelectronic Circuits", Oxfrod, 7th Ed.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Neaman,"Electronic Circuit Analysis And Design,"Irwin.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Power-point handouts
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Integrated-circuit amplifiers
2. Differential and multistage amplifiers
3. Frequency Response
4. Feedback
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
平時測驗 40%, 期中考 30%, 期末考 30%
七、可連結之網⾴位址
http://mx.nthu.edu.tw/~yunhwu/Electronics-2.htm

中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦學實驗⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronics Lab. II
任課教師  Instructor ：巫勇賢
上課時間  Time ： T9TaTbTc 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  304 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤  Not applicable
Syllabus:
In this course you will learn about the basic principles of circuit design and
operation in a practical, real-world laboratory setting. You will work both
with
discrete components such as resistors, capacitors, diodes, and transistors as
well
as with integrated components such as operational amplifiers and timer 555. In
addition, you will become familiar with the operation of basic electronic test
equipment (digital multi-meters, oscilloscopes, function generators, curve
tracers, etc.). In addition, you will further understand the characteristics
of
transistors through the semiconductor analyzer which is very important for
device
development. There are 12 experiments this semester.
Handout: Download from Web Site
http://greenelectronics.wixsite.com/yung-hsien-wu/
The schedule of this course can be found below.
Preview:
You are strongly encouraged to read ahead of the lectures. After each lecture,
you
should review the corresponding material in the textbook and then read the
next
section or two before the following lecture. This familiarization process will
allow you to digest information from the lectures more easily.
Grading:
The final grade will depend on the items with relative weights shown below:
Labs.... （出席 + 時間獎勵） 30 %
Quiz....................25 %
Final Exam..............20 %
Homework............……..20 %
Evaluation by TA .....…..5 %
Content:
Exp-1 Electrical Characteristics Measurement for NMOS Circuit
Exp-2 Electrical Characteristics Measurement for CMOS Circuit 　
Exp-3 Electrical Characteristics Measurement for BJT 　
Exp-4 Low Frequency Response for BJT Amplifier 　
Exp-5 High Frequency Response for BJT Amplifier 　
Exp-6 BJT Differential Amplifier 　
Exp-7 Basic Operation of OP741 　
Exp-8 Digital to Analog Converter 　
Exp-9 Analog to Digital Converter 　
Exp-10 Analog Comparator 　
Exp-11 555 Timer IC Application 　
Exp-12 Introduction to Semiconductor Analyzer

科號  Course Number ： 11220ESS
251000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：材料熱⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Thermodynamics of Materials
任課教師  Instructor ：朱鵬維
上課時間  Time ： T5T6F5F6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  504 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course includes three major parts: basic thermodynamics, solution
thermodynamics/binary phase diagrams, and chemical reactions. The first part
includes the three laws of thermodynamics, auxiliary functions, and free
energy calculation. The second part starts from gas behavior, one-component
system, solution behavior, and finally binary phase diagram. The third part
teaches gas-gas reactions and gas-solid reactions. Students will learn the
physical meaning of the three laws of thermodynamics, the calculation of
thermodynamic functions and the applications of thermodynamics in materials
science. This course aims to provide a basis for a variety of subsequent
courses in Materials Science.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
David R. Gaskell, David E. Laughlin, Introduction to the Thermodynamics of
Materials, 6th edition, Taylor & Francis Group, CRC Press, 2017.
● 參考書籍 (References)
(1) C.H.P. Lupis, Chemical Thermodynamics of Materials, Prentice Hall, 1983.
(2) R.T. DeHoff, Thermodynamics in Materials Science, 2nd edition, Taylor &
Francis Group, CRC Press, 2006.
(3) D.V. Ragone, Thermodynamics of Materials, Wiley, 1995.
(4) C.B.P. Finn, Thermal Physics, 2nd edition, Taylor & Francis Group, CRC
Press, 1993.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures with digital board writing and PowerPoint materials highlight
important concepts and calculation demonstrations.
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction & Definition of Terms
The First Law of Thermodynamics
The Second Law of Thermodynamics
Auxiliary Functions
Heat Capacity, Enthalpy, Entropy, and The Third Law of Thermodynamics
The Behavior of Gas
Phase Equilibrium in a One-Component System
The Behavior of Solutions
Construction of Binary Phase Diagram from Gibbs Free Energy Curves
Chemical Reactions of Gases and Gas-Solid System
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
30% of homework,
20% of 1st midterm exam,
25% of 2nd midterm exam,
25% of final exam.

notes, homework problems, etc.

本校公布之「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，以下說明

中文名稱  Course Title ：機率與統計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Probability and Statistics
任課教師  Instructor ：蕭百沂
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  503 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is an introductory course for statistics and probability for
undergraduate students. The purpose of this course is to introduce the methods
to handle the variability of experimental data and explain how to apply them
to real engineering problems. Topics include the basic concepts of
probability, discrete and continuous random variables, probability
distributions, sampling distributions, point estimation of parameters,
interval estimation for a single sample, various hypothesis tests, linear
regression, logistic regression, etc.
預備知識 : 微積分、⼯數⼀。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Montgomery/Runger, Applied Statistics and Probability for Engineers, 7th ed.,
John Wiley & Sons 2019
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Johnson, Miller & Freund's Probability and Statistics for
Engineers, Pearson (9th Ed.) 2018
2. Hayter, Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists, 4th ed.,
Brooks/Cole 2012.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
板書授課，每周授課 150 分鐘
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Basic concepts of probability
2. Discrete and continuous random variables
3. Probability distributions
4. Sampling distributions
5. Point estimation of parameters
6. Interval estimation
7. Hypothesis tests
8. linear regression
9. logistic regression

3. Final exam 35%
4. 點名（加分⽤ )

This course introduces the fundamental principles of heat transfer. This course
is a required course for the field of nuclear power plant technology, energy
engineering and system, and micro electric machines engineering. The topics covered
in the courses are listed in the following. AI is not applicable to this course.

中文名稱  Course Title ：物理冶⾦⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Physical Metallurgy II
任課教師  Instructor ：黃嘉宏
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  406 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Continuation of ESS3510 Principles of Physical metallurgy(I). The major
topics are: Annealing; nucleation and growth; solidification; nonferrous alloys;
ferrous alloys; fracture and creep(brief introduction); fatigue and corrosion
fatigue; stainless steels
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Physical metallurgy Principles, 4th ed. Reza Abbaschian, Lara Abbaschian and
Robert E. Reed-Hill, CL-Engineering, 2008
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Modern Physical metallurgy, 8th ed.
R.E. Smallman and A. H.W. Ngan, Elsevier Ltd, 2014.
2. Physical metallurgy, 5 ed.
D.E. Laughlin and K. Hono eds., Elsevier Ltd, 2014.
3. Physical metallurgy, 3rd ed.
P. Haasen, Cambridge, 1996
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and Discussion, Lecture notes will be handed out in the beginning
of the semester. Class recording audio files will be provided in Google drive.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Annealing of Cold Worked metals
2. Nucleation and Growth
3. Solidification
4. Physical metallurgy of Selected Nonferrous Alloys (Al, Cu)
5. Physical metallurgy of Ferrous Alloys
6. Fracture and Creep (Brief Introduction)
7. Fatigue and corrosion fatigue
8. Stainless steels
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
There will be two midterm exams (50%) and one comprehensive final exam
(40%). Problem set will be given constantly (10%).

中文名稱  Course Title ：氫能科技導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Hydrogen Energy Technology
任課教師  Instructor ：王翔郁
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7 上課教室  Room ：綠能 201 ／ 35
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
教學⽬的與課程說明
本課程希望讓學⽣對氫能有詳盡的認識並具備氫能科技中基本技術的知識。課程內容涵括氫氣的產
⽣，儲存，送，
能源上的利⽤，以及安全性評估。本課程讓同學了解與體會發展綠⾊能源的重要性，以及發展新能源
中需要加以考
慮的各個⾯向。
先修科⽬  無
教科書⽬  N/A
參考書⽬
1. Hydrogen Energy : Challenges and Prospects, Author(s): D A J Rand, R M Dell, RSC
Publishing. 2008.
2. Tomorrow's Energy, revised and expanded edition (Hydrogen, Fuel Cells, and the
Prospects for a Cleaner Planet) By Peter Hoffmann, The MIT Press. 2012.
上課⽅式
First 10 weeks: 2 hr lecture, 0.5 hr Q&A
Last 6 weeks: 2 hr HW discussion, 0.5 hour group discussion
成績考核
Midterm Exam: 60%
Weekly Group Presentation:20%
Final Presentations:10%
Personal Report:10%
課程內容
Why Hydrogen? What is the Hydrogen Economy?
Production of hydrogen: Steam reforming, thermal reforming
Production of hydrogen: Electrical lysis, oxidation of fossil fuel
derivatives
Production of hydrogen: Photocatalysis water splitting and biological routes
Storage and transportation of hydrogen: metal hydride, Carbohydrates, and
other composite
Storage and transportation of hydrogen: Compressed or liquefied, other
materials
Future aspects of hydrogen production and storage
Utilization of hydrogen as energy source: fuel cell and utility gas
Economic and safety aspects of hydrogen energy

科號  Course Number ： 11220ESS
415000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：數值分析⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Numerical Analysis II
任課教師  Instructor ：蕭百沂
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  506 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is the second semester course of the Numerical Analysis.
Students are assumed to have taken the course "Numerical Analysis I" and learned
the necessary knowledge.
As stated in the preface of the text book, the goal of this course is
"to introduce modern approximation techniques;
to explain how, why, and when they can be expected to work; and
to provide a foundation for further study of numerical analysis and scientific
computing"
本課程使⽤  atlab 講解所教授的  algorithms ，強調實際解題，⽤電腦找出答案。修課能精進
matlab的功⼒。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
none
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Burden/ Faires/ Burden, Numerical Analysis, 10th ed., CENGAGE Learning, 2016
2. Gilat/Subramaniam, Numerical Methods: An Introduction with Application Using
MATLAB 2en ed., (SI ed.), John Wiley & sons, 2011
3. Kincaid/ Cheney, Numerical Analysis: Mathematics of Scientific Computer 3rd
ed., American Mathematical Society, 2009
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Three-hour lectures per week ，板書上課。
課程將使⽤  matlab 演⽰課堂上所學到的各種數值⽅法
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. chap 7: Iterative techniques in matrix algebra
2. chap 8: Approximation theory
3. chap 9: Approximating eigenvalues
4. chap 10: Numerical solutions of nonlinear systems of equations
5. chap 11: Boundary value problems for ordinary differential equations
6. chap 12: Numerical solutions to partial differential equations
詳細的課程內容及進度 : 請參連結
https://mx.nthu.edu.tw/~pyhsiao/2024/2024_ess415000/2024_ess415000.htm
後⾯有  2022 授課進度。
授課主題包含 : steepest descent method ， conjugate gradient method ， power method ，
Schur decomposition, QR-decomposition, Householder’s reflection transformation ，
Singular value decomposition, fast Fourier transform ， finite difference method
to solve ODE and PDE, 等等。
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework 30%, Midterm exam 35%, Final exam 35%, 點名 ( 加分⽤ )
七、可連結之網⾴位址
https://mx.nthu.edu.tw/~pyhsiao/2024/2024_ess415000/2024_ess415000.htm
NB. 本課程無涉及 AI 使⽤

中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體製程
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Semiconductor Processing
任課教師  Instructor ：吳文發
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  503 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
此課程為半導體製程技術與原理的探討與介紹，可學習到半導體製程技術的演進、各製程步驟與製
程設備的主要技術原理及重要的基礎觀念，為從事積體電路製造、積體電路元件與積體電路設計的
核⼼基礎課程，有助學員⽇後投入半導體、光電、微機電與感測器等相關產業，課程內容包含 :
* Introduction of IC Fabrication
* Semiconductor Basics
* Wafer Manufacturing and Epitaxy
* Thermal Processes
* Photolithography
* Plasma Basics
* Ion Implantation
* Etch
* CVD and Dielectric Thin Film
* PVD and metallization
* Process Integration
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Hong Xiao, "Introduction to Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology", 2nd
Edition, SPIE Press, Bellingham, Washington USA, 2012.
半導體製程技術導論 ( 修訂⼆版 , 蕭宏  原著 ), 全華圖書 , 2014.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. M. Quirk and J. Serda, "Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology", Prentice
Hall, New Jersey, USA, 2001.
2. IEDM short course.
3. S. M. Sze and M. K. Lee, "Semiconductor Devices Physics and Technology”, 3rd
Edition, John Wiley & Sons, Inc., New York, USA, 2012.
4. James D. Plummer, M. D. Deal, and P. B. Griffin, "Silicon VLSI Technology:
Fundamentals, Practice and Modeling”, Prentice Hall, New Jersey, USA, 2000.
5. 莊達⼈ , "VLSI 製造技術 ”, ⾼立圖書 , 2002.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
綜合數本優良教科書的精華，適度補充 IEDM 會議所揭露的最新技術發展與趨勢，以 power point 編
撰上課講義，上課前將教材電⼦檔置於 eLearn 數位學習平台供學⽣下載預習。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction of IC Fabrication (3 hr)
2. Semiconductor Basics (3 hr)
3. Wafer Manufacturing and Epitaxy (3 hr)
4. Thermal Processes (6 hr)
5. Photolithography (6 hr)
6. Mid-term Exam.
7. Plasma Basics (3 hr)
8. Ion Implantation (3 hr)
9. Etch (6 hr)
10. CVD and Dielectric Thin Film (6 hr)
11. metallization (6hr)
12. Process Integration (3 hr)
13. Final Exam.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Examination (Twice), Homework, Report, Interaction at class
七、採⽤下列何項  AI 使⽤規則  (Indicate which of the following options you use to
manage student use of the AI)
基於透明與負責任的原則，本課程⿎勵學⽣利⽤ AI 進⾏協作或互學，以提升本⾨課產出品質。根據
本校公布之「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取有條件開放，說明如下
學⽣須於課堂作業或報告中的「標題⾴註腳」或「引⽤文獻後」簡要說明如何使⽤⽣成式 AI 進⾏議
題發想、文句潤飾或結構參考等使⽤⽅式。若經查核使⽤卻無在作業或報告中標明，教師、學校或
相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
本⾨課授課教材或學習資料若有引⽤⾃⽣成式 AI ，教師也將在投影片或⼝頭標注。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

427000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
50
中文名稱  Course Title ：機器學習導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Machine Learning
任課教師  Instructor ：吳順吉
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R5R6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces basic concepts in machine learning and their associated
mathematical tools. It is aimed at advanced undergraduates, and assumes no
previous knowledge of or machine learning concepts. Knowledge of multivariate
calculus, basic linear algebra some familiarity with probabilities would be
helpful but not essential. Topics to be covered include probability
distributions, supervised learning, Bayesian decision theory, parametric
methods, multivariate methods, dimensionality reduction, clustering,
nonparametric methods, decision trees, linear discrimination, multilayer
perceptrons, and deep learning.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Introduction to Machine Learning, Ethem Alpaydin, 3rd ed. 2014, The MIT Press.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Applied Statistics and Probability for Engineers, Douglas C.
Montgomery, 6th ed. 2014, John Wiley & Sons.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂授課，每周上課  150 分鐘
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Introduction
2. Math Background
3. Supervised Learning
4. Bayesian Decision Theory
5. Parametric Methods
6. Multivariate Methods
7. Dimensionality Reduction
8. Clustering
9. Nonparametric Methods
10. Linear Discrimination
11. Multilayer Perceptron
12. Deep Learning
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. Computer Assignments 40%
2. Personal Project (Oral Presentation + Report) 35%
3. Class Competition (Competition ranking) 25%
No make-up exam!!
Student use of the AI: Conditionally open; please specify how generative AI will
be used in course output.

430000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
80
中文名稱  Course Title ：固態物理導論⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Solid State Physics I
任課教師  Instructor ：吳永俊
上課時間  Time ： M7M8W5W6上課教室  Room ：⼯科  503 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程介紹固態物理的基本知識。固態物理導論⼀的重要課題，通常包含了量⼦⼒學
及統計熱⼒學，⽽電磁⼒是其最主要的作⽤⼒，因此修課學⽣應具備基本物理，及近代物理
之知識。
課程⽬標為把固態物質的特性具體的整理成多個主題，包含：晶體結構、倒晶格結構、能帶理論、⼒
學特性、電學特性、光學特性、磁學特性、熱學特性、聲⼦物理、半導體物理  … 等，做⼀深入等探
討，固態物理是⼀⾨應⽤的學科，學習或建構固態物理，是可以直接⽤來瞭解與解決固態材料
與⼯程的問題。  非常適合： 1. ⼤學部⼤三⼤四  材料科學 , 光電科學 , 電⼦科學 , 半導體科學相關領
域。 2. 碩⼠班未曾修過固態物理的之學⽣
Required background: Modern physics I, Engineering Mathematics
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Textbook: Introduction to Solid State Physics, the 8th edition, by C. Kittel
三、參考書籍 (References)
無
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
投影片教學 70%, 版書 30%
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Chap 1 Crystal structure
Chap 2 Reciprocal lattice
Chap 3 Crystal binding and elastic constants
Chap 4 Phonons I. Crystal vibrations
Chap 5 Phonons II. Thermal properties
Chap 6 Free-electron Fermi gas
Chap 7 Energy bands
Chap 8 Semiconductor crystals
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Grading: 作業 homework (10%), 期中考 midterm exam (40%), 期末考 final exam (50%)
七、可連結之網⾴位址
Not available yet

中文名稱  Course Title ：燃料電池原理與應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Principles and Applications of Fuel Cells

上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  501 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程涵蓋燃料電池領域之歷史發展、電極電位理論、電池原理、燃料電池種類、
各類型燃料電池之⼯作原理與應⽤範圍、燃料電池之發展瓶頸與現況、以及燃料電
池應⽤等主題，⾃淺⽽深提供學⽣有關燃料電池原理與技術的基礎知識、進階理論
與應⽤領域，使學⽣具備基本但完整的燃料電池知識，並能於未來的進修或⼯作中
加以應⽤。

John Wiley & Sons, Inc., England, 2000.
三、參考書籍 (References)

VCH, New York, 1996.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
⼝頭講授
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
燃料電池發展歷史（ 1 週）、電極電位理論（ 2 週）、電池原理（ 2 週）、
燃料電池種類及其⼯作原理（ 11 週）、燃料電池之應⽤（ 1 週）、
燃料電池之發展瓶頸與現況（ 1 週）

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
太陽光電創意系統實作。
歡迎⼤三，⼤四與碩⼠班⼀年級同學選修。⼤⼀，⼤⼆較不適合，應先修基礎課程後再選修。

中文名稱  Course Title ：專題演講
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Colloquium
任課教師  Instructor ：朱鵬維
陳馨怡
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. 計分⽅式：
本學期演講共 12 次，⼼得報告繳交 12 次則於期末可獲得基本成績 A 。
【加分⽅式】每次與講者互動提問加總成績⼀級分，累計最⾼⾄ A+ 。
【⼼得報告繳交】
內容要求：每次⼼得報告⾄少 100 個字以上且與該次演講內容相符。若未達 100 字簡略的⼼得報告或
⼼得內容與該次演講內容不相符則扣總成績⼀級分，並須於助教通知後在截⽌期限內補交⼼得單否則
當週視為缺交⼼得單。
準時繳交⼼得單：請於專題演講後繳交紙本⼼得單。
缺交⼼得單：扣分機制：每次扣五級分，如此在期末成績為基本分 A 的情況下，缺交 1 次即可讓期末
成績低於
B-，若無因提問加分將於期末不及格，請同學注意。
【不及格情況】
⼀次只能交⼀份⼼得報告，不可代交。如發現代寫⼼得情形，雙⽅學期成績零分，並送學務處以考試
作弊處置，沒有補救⽅法。
2. 請假規則：
每個專題演講皆會錄影並應需求在 eeclass 開放給同學觀看。
無法參加專題演講的同學可在提交假單後，使⽤ eeclass 平台於⼀週內觀看演講並於該演講後隔週四
中午 12點前繳交⼼得單⾄ eeclass ，若超過期限未繳交⼼得單則視為缺交⼼得單，每次扣五級分。
請假單請⾃⾏在 eeclass 下載，填寫後給指導老師簽名確認⽽後寄交助教。分為：
(1) 單次「專題演講請假單」
適⽤事假、病假等。每次請假申請須於該次演講結束後隔⽇週四中午 12 點前提交，否則視為遲交⼼
得單每次扣期末成績⼀級分。單⼀學期⾄多可申請三次請假，之後若無正當理由每個超過次數扣期末
成績⼀級分。
(2)「⻑期無法實際出席專題演講申請單」
適⽤於預期單⼀學期將超過三次以上無法實際出席專題演講之學⽣，僅適⽤在職⽣、駐校外單位執⾏
研究之學⽣等。校內學⽣不適⽤。此申請單須於開學後三周內提出申請，逾
期不受理。
3. Contact TAs for questions:
如有其他問題請聯絡助教：  ( 請依實際選課系所來連絡所屬助教 )
4. 以上內容若與實際上課公告不同，請以上課第⼀週公告之規則為依據。
5. ⽣成式⼈⼯智慧倫理聲明：禁⽌使⽤
本課程授課教師認為不宜於此⾨課程當中使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧於課堂學習當中。本課程的⼼得單需由
同學親⾃撰寫。
根據本校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取禁⽌使⽤，以
下為相關的監管機制：
修讀本⾨課程之學⽣應注意本⾨課不得繳交使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧所產出的作業、報告或個⼈⼼得。若
經查核發現，教師、學校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。
1. Grading Guide ：
There are 12 colloquium talks this semester. You need to submit 12 qualified
reports to get a basic final grade of A.
【 Bonus points 】 can be acquired through your on-site questions or critical
comments to the speaker → asking one question to the speaker deserves one bonus
grad point and can be accumulated up to A+.
【The submission of report form 】
Requirement: Each report needs to contain more than 100 words and be closely
related to the talk. A short or sketchy (<100 words) report or the content in
the reports is irrelevant to the talk, is regarded as a disqualified one, and
will result in a deduction in the final grade by one grade point. The student
should also resubmit a qualified report after receiving the notice from the TA
before the deadline; otherwise, the report is considered as a missed one that
causes a loss of five grade points at the end of the semester.
On-time submission: Report forms should be submitted as hard copies after the
talk.
Missed report: a missing report causes the deduction by five grade
points in the final grade and so on. Therefore, one missed report can result in
a final grade below B- without helps from the bonus points.
【Fail condition 】
Each person can only submit one report at a time, and you cannot help other
students to submit their reports. If we found out there are cases of plagiarism,
the semester scores of both parties would be zero, and they will be sent to the
school affairs office to deal with the act of cheating in the exam, and there is
no remedy.
2. Leave Rules:
Every colloquium talk will be recorded and will be available on eeclass when
requested. Students who cannot attend the colloquium can submit their leave
form, then watch the video on eeclass, and submit the report form (PDF file
only) to eeclass before noon (12 pm) of next Thursday after the talk.A missed
report causes
the deduction by five grade points in the final grade and so on. The leave form
can be downloaded from the eeclass platform. Please fill in the info and get it
signed by your advisor before you email it to the TA. There are two types of
leave forms:
(1) For single use: Leave Form
Applicable to personal leave, sick leave, etc. Each leave application form
should be handed to TA before noon (12 pm) of next day after the talk, or else
the report will be considered as a late submission. A maximum of three leave
applications are allowed for one semester. If your applications exceeded the
allowed chances without appropriate reason, each exceeded leave application will
result in a deduction in the final grade by one grade point.
(2) For long term use: Leave Form
Applicable to students who can't attend the colloquium more than three times.
E.g. on-job students, students who are doing research outside the university for
a long-term period, etc. Students staying at NTHU cannot apply. This application
form must be
submitted within three weeks after the start of the semester. Late application
will not be accepted.
3. Contact TAs for questions
If you have any other questions, please contact the TAs. (Please refer to your
enrolled department for the corresponding TAs.)
4. If there is any disagreement between this syllabus and the class
announcements, pleases refer to the rules announced in the class first week of
the semester.
5. Rules about generative AI: forbidden
Generative AI cannot be used in this course. The report form should be written
by the students without the aid of outside sources.
According to the rules announced by NTHU, generative AI is forbidden in this
course and is subjected to the following rules:
Students enrolled in the course cannot use generative AI to write the report
form. If any violation is identified, the report form will be rejected. Students
who enrolled in this course automatically agree these rules.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程為英語授課 , 研究⽣學習如何撰寫報告及發表成果 , 並實際練習之 .
This course is designed to provide students with opportunity to practice
their professional presentation skill, practically in the scientific and
technical areas. The students are expected to give a presentation on a suitable
scientific topic in English.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
None
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
In the first two weeks, the teacher will present the scientific discipline, how to
do research, and how to write and present a research work.
Then, students' presentations.
Presentation by students and discussions.
The students are required to prepare presentations in ppt file. The content
should include:
1. first page: research topic, student name, student ID no., thesis advisor,
date.
2. Introduction: research background, motivations, objectives
3. Review of related research papers and a summary.
4. Research methods/theory.
5. Research results and discussions.
6. Conclusion.

科號  Course Number ： 11220ESS
523300學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
25
中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體元件設計與模擬
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Semiconductor devices design and simulation
任課教師  Instructor ：吳永俊
上課時間  Time ： F3F4Fn 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  404 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
半導體元件設計與模擬  (Semiconductor devices design and simulation)
三學分 R234 ，為⼯科系 5 字頭的課研究所的課，因授權軟體關係，限 25 ⼈選修。選課限制為⼯科系研
究⽣，半導體學院研究⽣。
修課限制：由於電腦硬體，與  TCAD 模擬軟體使⽤執照之數量限制，⼈數限制為 25 ⼈。
先修課程  (Prerequisites): 半導體元件物理 (Semiconductor Physics and Devices) 與微
電
⼦⼯程  (Microelectronic Engineering) 研究所程度相當之課程。
 
教室：⼯科  404 電腦教室
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
教授半導體元件設計製程整合與電性及模擬，可以⽤來預測半導體元件  (N16 to N1) 的物理特性
如： MOSFET & FinFET 電場，電位，電⼦濃度分佈等；以及電學特性如：電流，電壓，臨界電
壓，操作頻率，反向器 (inverter) ，靜態隨機讀取記憶體 (SRAM) 等。藉由設計不同結構的半導體
元件，分析了解各個半導體製程與元件的參數對元件特性的影響，並分析其優缺點，如短通道效
應，臨界電壓，次臨界斜率，飽和電流等等。本課程的⽬的在於使學員了解半導體元件的設計與模
擬，擁有使⽤先進半導體元件設的基礎理論知識，並結合軟體輔助設計半導體元件的能⼒，進⽽能
夠模擬分析所設計的半導體元件的電性特性。本課程主要著重在 Silicon CMOSMOSE 電性模擬，接
著是設計 2D 以及 3D 的  Silicon CMOS FinFET, GAAFET, JLFET, CFET, FeFET 元件，最後將所
設計的 CMOS 元件，做電性模擬以及解讀模擬的結果。此課程所教授的設計與模擬技
術，在學術研究半導體產業有重⼤的實⽤性，並可增進半導體元件物理與微電⼦⼯程所學內容的實
踐性。適合從事半導體奈米元件研究開發的碩博⼠⽣修習。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
教師⾃編的最新半導體元件模擬整理講義與⼿冊
(Handout of related semiconductor devices simulation manual)
三、參考書籍 (References)
Modern Semiconductor Devices for Integrated Circuits, by Chenming Calvin Hu,
PEARSON, 2010.
2. "Fundamentals of Modern VLSI Devices, 2nd Edition" by Yuan Taur and Tak
Ning, 2009.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
電腦實際操作與投影片教學  (presentation by hand-writing and projection)
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
半導體元件設計與模擬介紹
2. 半導體元件模擬實驗設計及整合。
3. 半導體元件數值分析原理
4. 半導體元件之傳輸物理模型
5. 半導體元件物性模擬與解讀物性模擬結果
6. 2D以及 3D Silicon CMOS 元件設計
7. Silicon CMOS 元件模擬與解讀模擬結果
8. 3D鰭式電晶體 (3D FinFET) 的元件設計、模擬及分析
9. FinFET Inverter and SRAM
10. 先進奈米半導體元件的元件設計、模擬及分析
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
50% Homework, 50% final report
七、可連結之網⾴位址  (not available yet) and Q & A
Q1: 這⾨課與半導體元件物理或微電⼦⼯程有何差異 ?
A.: 此課程所教授的設計與模擬技術，在學術研究半導體產業有重⼤的實⽤性，並可增進半導體
元件物理與微電⼦⼯程所學內容的實踐性。所以需具備半導體元件物理 (Semiconductor
Physics and Devices) 與微電⼦⼯程的知識，適合從事半導體奈米元件研究開發的碩博⼠⽣修
習。
Q2: 需要有數值模擬的基礎嗎或修過相關的課嗎 ?
A. 非必要，上課會先教相關基礎必要的部分。  Q3. 需⾃備電腦與模擬程式嗎 ?
A. 上課地點為⼯科系電腦教室，由於數量限制修課⼈數為 15 ⼈，模擬程式部分請由個別實驗
室，向⾼速電腦中⼼申請遠端⼯作站使⽤。
Q4. 適合⼤學部學⽣選修嗎 ?
A. 完全不適合。由於先修課程 (Prerequisites) 限制修習過 : 半導體元件物理
(Semiconductor
Physics and Devices) 與微電⼦⼯程  (Microelectronic Engineering) 研究所程度相當之
課
程，所以⼤學部學⽣，恐怕無法吸收此研究所等級內容，只適合博⼠班與碩⼠班同學修習。

科號  Course Number ： 11220ESS
552000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等物理冶⾦
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Physical Metallurgy
任課教師  Instructor ：黃嘉宏
上課時間  Time ： T5T6F5F6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  406 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
based on thermodynamics of materials, reaction rate theory and diffusion
theory, this course includes the following topics: crystal interface and
microstructure, nucleation and growth theories, diffusional transformations in
solids, diffusionless transformation. The goal of this course is to teach
students the core knowledge of materials science, especially the application of
thermodynamics and kinetics in the most important phase transformations in
materials systems. The prerequisite courses are: thermodynamics of materials
(ESS2510 or equivalent), physical metallurgy I and II (ESS3510 and ESS3520).
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Phase Transformations in metals and Alloys, 3rd ed.
D.A. Porter and K.E. Easterling, and M.Y. Sherif
CRC Press, New York, 2009.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Physical metallurgy, 5 ed.,
D.E. Laughlin and K. Hono eds., Elsevier Ltd, 2014.
2. Mechanisms of diffusional phase transformations in metals and alloys,
H.I. Aaronson, M. Enomoto and J.K. Lee, CRC Press, New York, 2010.
3. Kinetics in nanoscale materials,
King-Ning Tu and Andriy M. Gusak, Wiley, New Jersey, 2014
4. Phase transformations in materials,
A.K. Jena and M.C. Chaturvedi, Prentice Hall, 1992.
5. The theory of transformations in metals and alloys (Part I + II), 3rd ed.,
J.W. Christian, Elsevier, 2002.
6. Phase Transformations in metals and Alloys, 4rd ed.
D.A. Porter and K.E. Easterling, and M.Y. Sherif
CRC Press, New York, 2022.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and Discussion, Lecturenotes will be handed out in the beginning of
semester. Lecture audio recordings are available online. Homework problems will
be emailed into student personal account. Please check your email account
constantly.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Prerequisite: Physical metallurgy, Thermodynamics of Materials
1. Introduction
2. Crystal Interface and Microstructure
3. Nucleation and Growth
4. Precipitation from Solid Solution
(1)Precipitation in Age-Hardening Alloys
(2)Precipitation of Ferrite from Austenite
(3)Cellular Precipitation
(4)Spinodal Decomposition
(5)Ordering Transformation
5. Diffusionless Transformation
- Martensitic Transformation
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
There will be one midterm exam (35%) and one final exam (45%). Problem
set will be given constantly (20%).
Depending on the number of the students in this class. If the class has less
than 15 students, the last two weeks will be arranged for a final oral
presentation. Students are expected to present a special topic that you
have learned in this class. The performance of the presentation will be
counted in the grade of final exam. Accordingly, final exam will be 30%
and the final presentation will be 15% of the semester grade. However, if
the number of the students is more than 15, final exam will be a regular
written test and the grade will be 45% of the semester grade.

中文名稱  Course Title ：同步輻射與中⼦束應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applications of Synchrotron Radiation and Neutron Beams
任課教師  Instructor ：李志浩
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  406 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
開課老師：李志浩教授，清華⼤學⼯程與系統科學系。
Professor Chih-hao Lee, Department of Engineering and System Science.
課程⽬標：提供全國理⼯背景之⼤學部⾼年級以上學⽣瞭解同步加速器設施及原⼦爐其應⽤的機會，
以
便將來利⽤同步加速器光源及中⼦源從事論文或研究⼯作。
課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程每周三上課⼩時並搭配參觀活動，使課堂教學與實務相互結合，以獲得更深入的
認識。
上課地點：清華⼤學⼯程與系統科學系 (406 教室 ) 。
參觀地點：國家同步輻射研究中⼼光束線，以及清華⼤學⽔池式核反應器與 X 光實驗室。
課程內容：以修習完⼤四理⼯基礎課程為標準，內容包括基本光學原理，基本結晶繞射學，同步加速
器
光源之基本原理，同步加速器之構造，中⼦源之產⽣ , 基本真空原理，紫外光光束線，中⼦與 X 光光束
線，材料科學上之應⽤，原⼦分⼦科學上之應⽤，⽣物科學上之應⽤，微機電元件科技上之應⽤， X
光、紅外光、光電⼦發射顯微術，同步加速器光源之未來前景 . 包含中⼦與 X 光⼩⾓度散射 , X 光表⾯
散射 , 中⼦非彈性散射 , X 光束與中⼦束比較等課程。另外安排 X 光繞射實習， X 光顯微術實習等，並參
觀同步輻射加速器與實驗設施 , 核輻射度量實驗室以及清華⽔池式核反應器中⼦束。
Class contents: It based on the science and technology courses of the senior
undergraduates, and to extend their knowledge on the applications of accelerator
beam and neutron sources. The contents include the accelerators and vacuum
technology; synchrotron radiation and neutron sources; radiation detection
technology; review of basic concept of optical principle, crystallographic
diffraction and scattering of X-ray and neutrons; X-ray absorption spectroscopy,
X-ray photoemission spectroscopy, and X-ray imaging; inelastic neutron scattering,
small angle scattering, thin film surface scattering etc.; the applications in
micromachining, lithograph, material characterization and biological science. This
course also includes a visit of National Synchrotron Radiation Research Center,
Radiation measurement lab, van de Graaf accelerator and Tsing-Hua Open Pool
Nuclear Reactor.
成績計算：期末考佔 34% ，期末報告 33%, 出席率，作業成績及上課表現佔 33% 。
Grading: Final examination 34%, Term paper 33%, class attend and homework 33%.
科號  Course Number ： 11220ESS
568001學分  Credit ： 2⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
18
中文名稱  Course Title ：輻射度量實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Radiation Detection and Measurement Lab.
任課教師  Instructor ：李志浩
上課時間  Time ： T8T9TaTb 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 102 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本實驗課的⽬的為配合輻射度量原理授課內容，訓練學⽣熟悉各種輻射偵檢系統，進⾏量測
學習。輻射量測實驗包括：輻射量測基本電⼦設備、計數統計 , 誤差傳遞 , ⽰波器 , 放⼤器 , 鑑
別
器, 以及多
頻道脈⾼分析儀等 . 偵檢器包括蓋格 - 米勒（ GM ）計數器特性與計數統計、 NaI(Tl) 碘化鈉閃爍偵檢
系統與加⾺
能譜、⼆極半導體偵檢器 , 氣體中⼦比例偵檢器與阿伐及⾙他粒⼦能譜、純鍺偵檢器（ HPGe ）與
⾼
解析加⾺能
譜, X-光螢光分析及 X 光影相技術等基本偵檢器的操作與量測技巧。此外並增加反應器實驗以瞭解
活化分析技
巧，讓學⽣實際⾄清華⽔池式反應器參觀。
This radiation measurement laboratory is to go with the course of
radiation detection and measurement. Its goal is to allow students to put
their
hands on many types of radiation detectors for practical training. The
experiments including: the understanding of nuclear electronic modules,
oscilliscope, preamplifiers and amplifiers, the discriminator, the
multichannel
analyzers, the counting statistics and error propagations. The detectors
include
the Geiger-Mueller counter, the NaI(Tl) scintillation counter, the surface
barrier detector, the neutron proportional counter, the high purity germanium
detectors for gamma ray spectroscopy, and Si pin diode for X-ray fluorescence
analysis and X-ray imaging. In addition, a visit of the Tsing Hua open pool
nuclear reactor and take a neutron activation analysis data.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
發實驗講義

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is a continuing course of "Plasma Engineering and Application" and
will be given in a project study approach. Students will conduct numerical
simulation of plasma discharges, e.g., capacitively coupled plasmas and
microwave plasmas.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
M. Liberman and A. Lichtenberg, Principles of Plasma Discharges and
Materials Processing, 2nd ed., 2005.
三、參考書籍 (References)

Engineering, 2004.
2. Yu P. Raizer, Gas Discharge Physics, 1997.
3. Recent journal articles from JVSTA, Physis of Plasmas, Applied Physics
Letters, PSST, etc.
4. Brian Chapman, Glow Discharge Processes, 1980.
5. F.F. Chen, Introduction to Plasma Physics and Controlled Fusion, 1984.
6. J. R. Roth, Industrial Plasma Engineering, 1996.
7. Oleg A. Popov, High Density Plasma Sources, 1995.
8. Afred Grill, Cold Plasma in Materials Fabrication, 1994.
9. O. Auciello and D. Flamm, Plasma Diagnostics, 1989

Course Description
The course aims to enhance students’ ability of English language in all
aspects. Students will have exercises that require them to incorporate listening,
reading, speaking and writing skills to boost their overall ability of English
communication. This training process, for this semester specifically, will be
realized in producing a project of which students demonstrate “how to” do
something. They will break down steps of process via various presentations on a
regular basis, including the midterm and the final presentations.
Course Requirement and Grading
The course highly expects students’ participation. Participation grade in
this class includes work done in class (peer review, feedback, etc.), attendance,
completed homework, active participation, a respectful attitude to the class, and
so on. Just being present in class does NOT automatically guarantee a high
participation grade.
Presentation A: 25%
Presentation B: 25%
Final Exam: 20%
Class activities: 20%
Participation: 10%

American Jetstream second edition (Advanced)

Classroom Activities
A. Presentation A: Unveiling Fake News: Fake news is prevalent in today's
society, requiring us to hone our critical thinking skills and develop
preventative measures against misinformation. In this exercise, you are tasked
with exploring this topic in conjunction with various themes from units 7 to 12.
Your presentation should last 20 minutes and include the following two parts.
1. Fake News: For the first 15 minutes, introduce a scenario involving both
fake news and a given topic, such as "get to work" from unit 7. Interact with your
audience. For instance, encourage them to guess the details of the scam and
discuss why such phenomena exist and who benefits from them. Then analyze the
scam. Discuss how the scammers can manipulate people by addressing the following
issues in your presentation:
1) Who are the likely targets in such a scam?
2) What are the likely objectives of the scammers?
3) To what extent and in what manner would the scammers potentially harm
others?
4) What legal responsibilities do the scammers bear?
5) What are the associated costs, including staff and financial expenses, to
conduct such scams?
6) Are there any measures we can take to prevent the scam?
2. Skit: For the second part of the presentation (around 3-5 minutes), you
are tasked with creating and performing a short play centered around a scam,
incorporating elements from the provided unit. For instance, your play could delve
into the qualities of successful businesspersons discussed in "what's the best way
to succeed in business?" (p79), illustrating how individuals aspiring to become
successful may fall victim to scams due to their pursuit of such an aspirational
self-image.
Grading Rubric for Presentation A
A. Content
1) Fake News
＊ Clarity: Is the main message of the presentation clear and easy to
understand?
＊ Relevance: Does the presentation effectively connect the topic of fake
news with the assigned unit topics?
＊ Engagement: Does the presentation engage the audience's interest and keep
them focused?
＊ Ethical Consideration: Is there thoughtful consideration of the ethical
implications involved in the proposed scams?
2) Skit
＊ Plot Development:
- Originality, creativity, clarity and coherence of the dramatization and
storyline.
- Depth of exploration into the themes related to the given topic (in this
case the success in business and susceptibility to scams.)
＊ Character Development: Depth of insight into the motivations and behaviors
of characters involved in the scam.
B. Language
=548; Language Accuracy: Are sentences grammatically correct and free of errors?
=548; Vocabulary: Does the presentation demonstrate a range of appropriate
vocabulary related to the topic?
=548; Fluency: Are presenters able to speak smoothly and without hesitation?
=548; Pronunciation: Are words pronounced clearly and accurately?
=548; Listening and Responding: Can presenters understand and respond to
questions from the audience effectively?
B. Presentation B: Article Insights
In this presentation (25-30 min), students will report on one or two assigned
articles from our Norton Reader. While students may briefly touch upon language
issues, such as vocabulary, grammar, and unclear sentences, this aspect should be
addressed in passing for no more than 3 minutes.
The primary objective of this presentation is to conduct research based on the
themes presented in the articles. For instance, taking the article "Fighting for
Gun Culture" (p. 516) as an example, presenters may choose to delve into the
context of the NRA, the Second Amendment, etc. They can include information from
any media, such as clips, interviews, news stories, etc.
The aim is for students to develop their own perspective on a given topic by
drawing relevance from various sources. This is to demonstrate the presentation’s
approach in understanding the article, which should be reflected in the discussion
questions they make for the class.
The discussion questions from the presenters should be designed to provoke the
class to discuss, even without close reading of the article.
Grading Rubric for Presentation B
A. Discussion Questions and Engagement:
=548; Do questions provoke critical thinking and engagement?
=548; Are students actively involved in the discussion?
B. Relevance of Resources and Understanding:
=548; Are resources directly linked to article themes?
=548; Does the presentation demonstrate a thorough understanding of the
article's content?
C. Delivery and Clarity:
=548; Are presenters clear, confident, and articulate?
=548; Is the presentation well-structured and easy to follow?
Disclaimer:
The schedule and class activities are subject to change at the discretion of the
instructor, who may adjust them according to various factors as required to
optimize teaching. Changes may include: how students’ receive class materials;
change of lecture models (i.e. from face-to-face to long distance or vice versa
due to school or national requirements), etc. Students may or may not be offered
information for specific dates and/or content of in-class activities. There is
always a likelihood of "pop quizzes" or other activities occurring during any
given class, of which everything covered in the class is a fair game. Students who
are absent for whatever reasons are NOT immune to any responsibilities as normal
registered course takers. In other words, they should actively seek information or
opportunities for bonus points for in-class activities that take place when
absent, regardless of whether a class is officially "excused" or not. Performance
of tasks are necessary, regarding of status of being "excused" or not, and must be
made up through bonus points. It is wise to always double check with the assistant
for any ambiguities in terms of class rules and to verify one's make-up bonus
points.
Classroom Conduct
1. Attendance/ Absence:
- Two points from your Final Grade will be deducted per absence.
- You can be absent up to two times without having points deducted. This
includes all excuses (sick leave, personal leave, official leave, etc.)
- Students with absences more than 5 times, excused or not, will not be
allowed to participate the final exam (will result in an F grade).
- Tardiness and Roll Call:
1) You are expected to attend all class meetings ON time. If you’re 15 min.
late, then you’re counted as “absent” for the class period. During the class
periods, if I notice some students are missing, I might take roll again. Those who
are absent will be counted “absent” on that day.
2) Roll call—this can happen anytime during the class periods. If you happen
to be temporarily absent (i.e. in the bathroom), it is YOUR responsibility to
inform the assistant on the SAME day. Otherwise you are counted as absent.
2. Exams and Assignments:
- All assignments are due on the dates announced and/or indicated on the
syllabus. Assignments are collected at the beginning of each class (in a face-to-
face setting). No late assignments will be accepted unless you have made
arrangements with the instructor prior to the due date. Please provide your full
Chinese name and student number in order to secure your grades.
- Quiz Format: Our standard quizzes cover vocabularies from the first two
lessons of each unit. Please bring your own piece of paper to jot down the
spellings and their corresponding explanations (in either English or Chinese).
- No makeup of any class activities, including writing exercises, quizzes,
presentations (if any), etc. In the case of long-distance learning, you are
responsible to make sure your internet works fine. No exceptions will be made for
late in-class assignments.
- All makeup Exams (Midterm and Final Exam only) will be lowered by 20% and
will be substantially more difficult that the exam given in class.
- Being tardy for exams (more than 20 min. late) will result in a thirty
percent deduction from the exam grade. Students who arrive one hour late are not
allowed to take the exam.
3. Participation and Bonus Points:
- Students will be called on to answer questions, and this participation of
class discussion is regarded highly. Your participation grade in this class
includes work done in class, your attendance, completed homework, a respectful
attitude to the class, and so on. Just being present in class does NOT
automatically guarantee a high participation grade.
- Students who participated the class by voluntarily expressing their
thoughts can earn 1 bonus point each time. Bonus points may be accumulated to
reach a maximum of 5 points. Please notify the instructor for this part of grade
before class dismissal of SAME day you articulate your thoughts in class. Overdue
notification will not count.
- You have the opportunity to earn bonus points by conducting an interview
with a professional in the field relevant to your Presentation A. This interview
can earn you up to 3 points, contingent on your performance. The interview should
be recorded for a duration of 8-10 minutes, with a well-prepared set of interview
questions. Please coordinate with the instructor to arrange a presentation of the
recording and the interview questions.
- Another opportunity to earn bonus points is by presenting an article from
The Norton Reader that is not part of our assigned readings. In this presentation,
you are expected to analyze the chosen work without the use of visual aids. You
should aim to keep your presentation within the 8-10 minute range, demonstrating
your grasp of the prose style and structure. This presentation can earn you up to
3 points, depending on your performance. Contact your instructor no later than
week 14 to schedule your presentation.
4. Classroom Civility: All students are expected to turn off their electronic
devices (i.e. cell phone). Please show respect to the class at all times. Any
disruptive behavior, such as chatting, or playing music, will not be tolerated. If
you do not agree with something, it is your right to RESPECTFULLY bring that to
the attention of the class in a polite manner. Suggestions are always welcome. Any
behavior that disturbs the class will cause a grade deduction (such as talking to
your fellow classmates, talking on or playing with cell phones, and so on). Five
points of a student's final grade will be deducted each time the instructor's
warning is ignored.

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Literature II
任課教師  Instructor ：黃仕宜

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
文學作品導讀⼀
Spring 2024
Thu. 9am-1150am
C406
Instructor: 黃仕宜  (Joy Huang)
E-mail: shihyihuang@mx.nthu.edu.tw
Office: ⼈社 A512
Extension number: 42705
助理：郭孟勳
This course aims to prepare students' ability of comprehension, appreciation and
critical thinking on literature works. Students will achieve the goal through
study of canonical works, presentation or research of historical and cultural
backgrounds, class discussion and writing, and most likely their preparation for
exams.

Grading: 學期成績計算⽅式
◆ Usual performance (quizzes, activities and/or assignments) ： 30 %
◆ Participation: 10%
◆ Midterm ： 30.0 %
◆ Final： 30.0 %
Classroom Activities
Exams: There will be a Midterm exam and a Final exam. Both are in-class tests. The
exams may include multiple-choice questions, short answer questions and essay
questions, though not necessarily limited to and/or include all of these types.
The exams may cover the texts, the topics we discuss, and so on. I recommend you
take notes during class discussions.
Quizzes: We will have quizzes to cover the reading materials throughout the whole
semester. Our quizzes will cover a few questions concerning to basic information
of the plot.
Disclaimer:
The schedule and class activities are subject to change at the discretion of the
instructor, who may adjust them according to various factors as required to
optimize teaching. Changes may include: how students’ receive class materials;
change of lecture models (i.e. from face-to-face to long distance or vice versa
due to school or national requirements), etc. Students may or may not be offered
information for specific dates and/or content of in-class activities. There is
always a likelihood of "pop quizzes" or other activities occurring during any
given class, of which everything covered in the class is a fair game. Students who
are absent for whatever reasons are NOT immune to any responsibilities as normal
registered course takers. In other words, they should actively seek information or
opportunities for bonus points for in-class activities that take place when
absent, regardless of whether a class is officially "excused" or not. Performance
of tasks are necessary, regarding of status of being "excused" or not, and must be
made up through bonus points. It is wise to always double check with the assistant
for any ambiguities in terms of class rules and to verify one's make-up bonus
points.
Classroom Conduct
1. Attendance/ Absence:
- Two points from your Final Grade will be deducted per absence.
- You can be absent up to two times without having points deducted. This
includes all excuses (sick leave, personal leave, official leave, etc.)
- Students with absences more than 5 times, excused or not, will not be
allowed to participate the final exam (will result in an F grade).
- Tardiness and Roll Call:
1) You are expected to attend all class meetings ON time. If you’re 15 min.
late, then you’re counted as “absent” for the class period. During the class
periods, if I notice some students are missing, I might take roll again. Those who
are absent will be counted “absent” on that day.
2) Roll call—this can happen anytime during the class periods. If you happen
to be temporarily absent (i.e. in the bathroom), it is YOUR responsibility to
inform the assistant on the SAME day. Otherwise you are counted as absent.
2. Exams and Assignments:
- All assignments are due on the dates announced and/or indicated on the
syllabus. Assignments are collected at the beginning of each class (in a face-to-
face setting). No late assignments will be accepted unless you have made
arrangements with the instructor prior to the due date. Please provide your full
Chinese name and student number in order to secure your grades.
- No makeup of any class activities, including writing exercises, quizzes,
presentations (if any), etc. In the case of long-distance learning, you are
responsible to make sure your internet works fine. No exceptions will be made for
late in-class assignments.
- All makeup Exams (Midterm and Final Exam only) will be lowered by 20% and
will be substantially more difficult that the exam given in class.
- Being tardy for exams (more than 20 min. late) will result in a thirty
percent deduction from the exam grade. Students who arrive one hour late are not
allowed to take the exam.
- If you have any questions about the midterm exam questions, please review
them on the day they are presented (usually the week after the midterm exam). They
will not be accepted afterward. All deadlines are based on the syllabus, and late
submissions will not be accepted to avoid increasing administrative work.
3. Participation and Bonus Points:
- Students will be expected to actively engage in class discussions by
answering questions. Participation in class discussions is highly valued for your
overall grade in this course, which encompasses in-class contributions,
attendance, completed homework, maintaining a respectful attitude, and active
participation. Mere presence in class does not guarantee a high participation
grade; rather, your performance and communication with the instructor will
determine your grade.
- Students who participated the class by voluntarily expressing their
thoughts can gain 1 bonus point each time. Bonus points may be accumulated to
reach a maximum of 5 points. Please email to notify the assistant for this part of
grade on the SAME day you articulate your thoughts in class. Overdue notification
will not count.
- You may earn bonus points by attending literary and theatrical
events/forums. Each attendance will earn you 2 points, and you may accumulate at
most 4 bonus points through this means. To get the points, you will need to show
the ticket stub (if not applicable, a signature from the organizers/moderators on
the brochure/flyer) stapled onto a 250-words summary of that event. (Turn-in due
date: 16th week).
- You have the opportunity to earn bonus points by presenting poems from the
anthology that are not included in our reading list. Your presentation should last
around 8-10 minutes and primarily focus on your personal reflection on the poem,
with a brief introduction to the work lasting no more than 1 minute. Your
presentation should mainly explore why you selected the poem(s) and how they
resonate with you. While visual aids are permitted, relying too heavily on
reciting from slides will not result in high grades. Each presentation can earn
you up to 3 points, depending on your performance, and you may present up to 2
poems. Please contact our assistant with the poems you wish to present no later
than week 13 for us to schedule your presentations.
4. Classroom Civility: All students are expected to turn off their electronic
devices (i.e. cell phone). Please show respect to the class at all times. Any
disruptive behavior, such as chatting, or playing music, will not be tolerated. If
you do not agree with something, it is your right to RESPECTFULLY bring that to
the attention of the class in a polite manner. Suggestions are always welcome. Any
behavior that disturbs the class will cause a grade deduction (such as talking to
your fellow classmates, talking on or playing with cell phones, and so on). Five
points of a student's final grade will be deducted each time the instructor's
warning is ignored.

會話部份善⽤句型 , 練習實⽤⽇常會話 .
不定時⼩考及作業。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
本學期進度 : ⼤家的⽇本語第 6~12 課
每2週 1課之進度 , 學習文法及練習會話 , 聽⼒ , 解讀

● 課程說明 (Course Description)
培養學⽣具備⽇語初級之聽說讀寫及簡單溝通能⼒。
課堂間穿插⽇本文化及有趣⽇本⼩知識。
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
《⼤家的⽇本語初級  I 改訂版》
● 參考書籍 (References)
《⼤家的⽇本語初級 Ⅰ}39;Ⅱ 改訂版  句型練習冊》台北：⼤新書局
《⼤家的⽇本語初級  I}39;II 聽解 タスク  25 》 台北：⼤新書局
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1. 約每 6⼩時完成⼀課《⼤家的⽇本語初級  I 改訂版》
2. 上課⽅式主要分為「單字解說」、「句型文法講解與練習」、「會話發表」、「課題演練」。
輔以相關之教材加強聽⼒及⽣活化⽇語。
● 教學進度 (Syllabus) 如遇放假則課程彈性調整

第12週  第⼗⼀課會話  句型演練
第13週  第⼗⼆課單字  文法練習

第16週  期末考
經仔細考量後，本課程授課教師認為不宜於此⾨課程當中使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧於課堂學習當中。因本
課程的內
容於⽣成式 AI 中尚有諸多錯誤，且容易影響學⽣對基礎核⼼知識之判讀。
根據本校公布之佈的「⼤學教育場域 AI 協作、共學與素養培養指引」，本⾨課程採取禁⽌使⽤，以下
為相關的
監管機制
修讀本⾨課程之學⽣應注意本⾨課不得繳交使⽤⽣成式⼈⼯智慧所產出的作業、報告或個⼈⼼得。若
經查核發
現，教師、學校或相關單位有權重新針對作業或報告重新評分或不予計分。
修讀本課程之學⽣於選課時視為同意以上倫理聲明。

範圍
1⼤家的⽇本語 ( 初級⼀ ) 之 L6~L12
2補充教材為相關實物圖片影片 …… 等
3現代經典⽇文情歌
內容
1 ⽇文時態的⾶碟概念 ----“ 過去式 ” 與 ” 未來式 ” 的時空定律
2 Costco買的悲情鑽戒 * で 的重要性 “ Ｐ で 買 う / 在～～買 ”
3 當名詞男友相遇動詞女友套上的定情戒 “ Ｎ を Ｖ ”
4 戴著⾯具講⽇文的 ます 形 . 展現隱強勢的  ” ましょう / 我們 ~~ 吧 ”
5 ⽊已成⾈的 ” もう＋ Ｖ た / 已經～～ ”
6 告⽩氣球 ” Ａ がわかる  / 我懂 A”. ” Ａ が 好 き  / 我喜歡 A”
7 辦案⽇文聽清楚 “ 不～～（ ません） ” 與 ” 沒～～（ ませんでした） ”
8 勸拐⽇文 “ Ｖ２＋ ませんか / 要不要～～啊 ”
9 ⼀⽣別⽤的借貸⽤語 “ ⼈ に Ｎ を 借 りる / 向⼈借～～ ”
10 糊塗機⻑的迷航廣播 ?!“ ⾶⾏機 で 時間 かかる / 搭⾶機花～～時間 ”
11 兩款蜂蜜形容詞 ” 純蜜Ａ - い  ＆  不純蜜Ａ - な ”
12 展現⽇式體貼的 ” ⼈ にもらう / 向⼈拿取 . ⼈給 ”
13 聯誼勁技場 ” 我擅⻑～～ / Ｎ が 上⼿ です “” 我擁有 ~~/N があります ”
14 比起 A 友 , B 友更好的比較⽇文 " より ". 辯解⽇文 ” 因為所以的 から ”
15 ⽇本的風花雪⽉ ” 京都 は 雪 でした / 京都下雪 ”
16 體貼國度 ---- ⽇本路⼈幫提橘⼦ !!” みかんを 數詞買 った  / 買了～～個橘⼦ ”
課末穿插⽇文情歌教唱

教學型式：
⼀、理論講述與討論
主要教授基礎⽇語之文法 . 語彙 . 句型 . 聽⼒等語學課程 . 尤其著重訓練學員之⼝說發展與聽解能⼒ . 並
穿插以文化⾯導說 , 依教材內容加入講授⽇本之氣候風⼟ . 文化⺠俗 . 流⾏動態 . 禮法習慣 . 語彙源流 .
史地國情 ….. 等 . 期讓學員能深刻感受 , 擁有外語才能 , 即如握擁開啟世界視窗之鑰。
⼆、個案分析與作品賞析
以圖解及放映投影片⽅式講析文法句型，並強調⼝⽿學習，訓練學員與⾳檔⽇語同步對嘴及逐步對
譯,並加重刺激其⼤腦之中⽇文轉換反應。課間介紹並播放動聽之⽇本情歌 , 部份曲⽬亦安排⽇文歌
曲教唱
三 其他
1 期讓學員在習得基礎語學之同時 , 能拓寬國際視野 , 培養包容異文化之胸襟。
2 幫助學員⽇後赴⽇洽商修習或與⽇⼈共事時 , 能因掌握⽇語之措辭技巧與⽇⼈之⾏動邏輯 , ⽽知⼰
知彼 ,創造全勝

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Beginning Spanish II

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本課程主要⽬的在於培養 A1 入⾨級⻄語能⼒。透過課堂講解與互動練習，引導學⽣學習基礎發⾳、詞
彙和語法規則，以及發展個⼈⽣活領域基本溝通技能。學⽣將學會如何在餐廳點菜、描述城市社區、
談興趣嗜好、逛街購物以及旅遊度假等。另外，配合教學內容介紹⻄語國家相關文化，藉此增進語⾔
理解與運⽤能⼒。
⼆、指定⽤書
Español en marcha Básico Nueva edición.Libro del alumno. Ed.SGEL, 2021. (ISBN:
9788417730574)
三、參考書籍
- Baralo, Marta. Vocabulario: elemental A1-A2. Madrid: Anaya, 2013.
- Borobio,Virgilio. ELE actual A1. Libro del alumno. Madrid: Ediciones SM, 2012.
- Castro, Francisca. Uso de la gramática española Elemental. Madrid: Edelsa,
2011.
- Sánchez Lobato, Jesús y García Fernández, Nieves. Nuevo español 2000 –nivel
elemental. Libro del alumno. Madrid: SGEL, 2007.
四、教學⽅式
課堂講解、師⽣互動、分組練習、朗讀文本、使⽤多媒體輔助教材等
五、教學內容進度
第1週  課程介紹  / Unidad 5 餐廳點菜、談興趣喜好和休閒娛樂、如何看說明指⽰  / 動詞
“gustar”、肯定命令式規則動詞變化  / ⻄班牙飲食文化
第2週  Unidad 5
第3週  Unidad 5
第4週  Unidad 6 詢問和指⽰⼤眾運輸相關資訊、請求幫忙、描述社區與城市  / 肯定命令式不規則
動詞變化、 Poder + infinitivo 、區分 ser 和 estar 的不同  / ⾺德⾥地鐵、⻄班牙社區、墨⻄哥城
市
第5週  Unidad 6
第6週  Unidad 6
第7週  Unidad 7 打電話邀約、描述⼈物外貌性格特徵、留訊息給他⼈  / 現在進⾏式  estar +
gerundio / ⻄語國家年輕⼈休閒活動
第8週  期中考
第9週  Unidad 7
第10週  Unidad 7
第11週  Unidad 8 問路和指⽰、講述昨⽇⽣活、談天氣  / 簡單過去式 pretérito indefinido 規則
和不規則動詞變化  / 墨⻄哥節慶、⻄班牙旅遊

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Beginning Spanish II

上課時間  Time ： MnM5M6 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C411 ／ 120
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1.課程說明 :
本課程將延續上學期的進度，以⻄班牙語分級 A1 程度的課程為⽬標，藉由文法講解、句型及對話練
習，營造不同場景來練習⻄班牙語對話。同時，配合各種學習資源 (google document,
youtube, 繪本 , ⾓⾊扮演 ...etc) 增加各種不同媒介的⼝語練習⽅式，讓⻄班牙語的學習，更貼近實際
的⽣活，漸進式的增加⻄班牙語能⼒。
2.指定⽤書 :
鄭雲英，《全新開始  學⻄班牙語》，台北 : 國際學村， 2023 年。
3.參考書籍 :
1) Marta Baralo, Marta Genís, María Eugenia Santana, Vocabulario Elemental A1-A2,
Madrid: Anaya, 2010. (ISBN: 978-84-667-7756-8)
2) Concha Moreno, Carmen Hernández, Clara Miki Kondo, Gramática Elemental A1-A2,
Madrid: Anaya 2007. (ISBN: 978-84-6676431-5)
3) Equipo Nuevo Prisma, Nuevo Prisma fusión A1+A2, Madrid: Edinumen, 2014 (ISBN:
978-84-9848-520-2)
4) 林⽟葉、曾麗蓉，《⻄班牙語新編》上，台北 : 敦煌書局， 2007 年。 (ISBN: 978-957-606-602-
3)
5) Silvia ⽥，《我的第⼀本⻄班牙語文法》，台北 : 國際學村， 2016 年。 (ISBN: 978-986-454-
104-1)
4. 教學⽅式 :
1) 講述
2) 對話及情境練習
3) 短篇寫作
4) 回答問題
5) 課後作業
5. 教學進度 :

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Beginning Spanish II

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本課程主要⽬的在於培養 A1 入⾨級⻄語能⼒。透過課堂講解與互動練習，引導學⽣學習基礎發⾳、詞
彙和語法規則，以及發展個⼈⽣活領域基本溝通技能。學⽣將學會如何在餐廳點菜、描述城市社區、
談興趣嗜好、逛街購物以及旅遊度假等。另外，配合教學內容介紹⻄語國家相關文化，藉此增進語⾔
理解與運⽤能⼒。
⼆、指定⽤書
Español en marcha Básico Nueva edición.Libro del alumno. Ed.SGEL, 2021. (ISBN:
9788417730574)
三、參考書籍
- Baralo, Marta. Vocabulario: elemental A1-A2. Madrid: Anaya, 2013.
- Borobio,Virgilio. ELE actual A1. Libro del alumno. Madrid: Ediciones SM, 2012.
- Castro, Francisca. Uso de la gramática española Elemental. Madrid: Edelsa,
2011.
- Sánchez Lobato, Jesús y García Fernández, Nieves. Nuevo español 2000 –nivel
elemental. Libro del alumno. Madrid: SGEL, 2007.
四、教學⽅式
課堂講解、師⽣互動、分組練習、朗讀文本、使⽤多媒體輔助教材等

第1週  課程介紹  / Unidad 5 餐廳點菜、談興趣喜好和休閒娛樂、如何看說明指⽰  / 動詞
“gustar”、肯定命令式規則動詞變化  / ⻄班牙飲食文化
第2週  Unidad 5
第3週  Unidad 5
第4週  Unidad 6 詢問和指⽰⼤眾運輸相關資訊、請求幫忙、描述社區與城市  / 肯定命令式不規則
動詞變化、 Poder + infinitivo 、區分 ser 和 estar 的不同  / ⾺德⾥地鐵、⻄班牙社區、墨⻄哥城
市
第5週  Unidad 6
第6週  Unidad 6

gerundio / ⻄語國家年輕⼈休閒活動
第8週  期中考
第9週  Unidad 7
第10週  Unidad 7

和不規則動詞變化  / 墨⻄哥節慶、⻄班牙旅遊

中文名稱  Course Title ：英語⼝語訓練⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： English Oral Practice(II)
任課教師  Instructor ：黃仕宜
上課時間  Time ： M5M6 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C406 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
英語⼝語訓練⼆ (English Oral Practice)
Spring 2023
Mon. 1320-1520
C406
Instructor: 黃仕宜  (Joy Huang)
E-mail: shihyihuang@mx.nthu.edu.tw
Office: ⼈社 A512
Extension number: 42705
Our goal for this second semester of oral training is to focus on debating skills.
For the first half of the semester, we will concentrate on learning, familiarizing
and practicing various dimensions of debating skills, such as the roles of the
three affirmative and negative speakers, the adjudicators, the debate moderator,
etc. In the process, we will relate skills learned from the first semester to this
specific model of public speaking. This will then prepare students for the second
half of the semester in which they will be paired up to conduct their own debates
with participation of the whole class. Throughout the semester, we will be looking
at our lessons in the textbook from this particular perspective. We might also be
learning how to generate debate topics from controversies of different fields
through speakers the instructor invites from outside of the class. Our regular
midterm and final presentations will be designed in a way that students can use
them to sharpen their debating skills, such as learning to define key terms,
practice researching useful information, maintain a professional manner while
conveying emotionally engaging speech.
Textbook: Communication Strategies 4
Grading Criteria:
Midterm Presentation (prepared speech): 25%
Final Presentation (impromptu speech): 25%
Debate Conduction: 20%
In-Class Activities: 20%
Participation: 10%
Tentative Schedule:
Date Week

2/26 2 Unit 8 (Role Learning: The first affirmative/Negative speaker)
3/4 3 Unit 9 (Role Learning: The second affirmative/Negative speaker)
3/11 4 Unit 10 (Role Learning: The third affirmative/Negative speaker)
3/18 5 Unit 11 (Role Learning: The adjudicators and the moderator)
3/25 6 Unit 12
4/1 7 Midterm
4/8 8 Unit 13
Debate 1

This schedule is subject to change by instructor at all times.
Classroom conduct:
1. Attendance/ Absence:
- Two points from your Final Grade will be deducted per absence.
- You can be absent up to two times without having points deducted. This
includes all excuses (sick leave, personal leave, official leave, etc.)
- Tardiness and Roll Call:
a. You are expected to attend all class meetings ON time. If you’re 15 min.
late, then you’re counted as “absent” for the class period. During the class
periods, if I notice some students are missing, I might take roll again. Those who
are absent will be counted “absent” on that day.
b. Roll call—this can happen anytime during the class periods. If you happen
to be temporarily absent (i.e. in the bathroom), it is YOUR responsibility to
inform the teacher on the SAME day. Otherwise you are counted as absent.
c. Students with absences more than 5 times, excused or not, will not be allowed
to participate the final presentation (will result in an F grade).
2. Please provide your full Chinese name and student number in order to
secure your grades in all exams and class activities.
3. No makeup of any class activities.
4. Bonus Points: You may earn bonus points by participating in speech
contests (whether you win any prize or not). Each time you participate will earn
you 3 points, and you may accumulate at most 6 bonus points through this means. To
get the points, you will need to show some proof, as well as recounting the
experience to the class.
5. Participation: Students will be called on to answer questions, and this
participation of class discussion is regarded highly. Your participation grade in
this class includes work done in class, your attendance, completed homework, a
respectful attitude to the class, and so on. Just being present in class does NOT
automatically guarantee a high participation grade.
6. Classroom Civility: All students are expected to turn off their electronic
devices (i.e. cell phone). Please show respect to the class at all times. Any
disruptive behavior, such as chatting, or playing music, will not be tolerated. If
you do not agree with something, it is your right to RESPECTFULLY bring that to
the attention of the class in a polite manner. Suggestions are always welcome. Any
behavior that disturbs the class will cause a grade deduction (i.e. talking to
your fellow classmates, talking on or playing with cell phones, and so on). Five
points of a student's final grade will be deducted each time the instructor's
warning is ignored.
Absence and Late Work:
All assignments are due on the dates announced and/or indicated on the syllabus.
There will be no make-up presentations/ assignments.
Appendix: Debate Conduction
Each group of two (2) students needs to organize a debate. The organizers can take
positions of either the moderators or the adjudicators, or both (at least 1 of the
members needs to be the moderator). The rest of the class serves as adjudicators.
There must be time for adjudicators to orally comment on the overall performance.
Student(s) with highest score will have 3 bonus points counted towards their final
grades.
The organizers’ job may include but are not limited to the following:
Before the class:
1. Establish the rules of the debate, including timelines.
2. Assigning different roles to students in the class.
3. Research the topic and arrange time for the class to do the research.
During the class
4. Time management for conducting your debate activities (arranging time for
the class to do research, for the groups to debate, and for the adjudicators to
comment and so forth as needed, according to your topic)
After the class
5. Upload your report to eeclass by the end of the given day you have
conducted the debate. The report shall include 3 parts:
1) The Topic: Write a report in terms of how you chose this topic, what makes
you think it is worth debating, and your research experience in general, etc.
2) The Performance: What do you observe during the performance? Are there any
new ideas generated? Is there any stagnation during the debate? Discuss debate
phenomena in class and provide explanations.
3) The adjudicators’ reports (assessments and the results)
